4404springzfx8992037closed2018-10-24T10:34:32Z2018-10-26T14:34:37Zfixed an issue where corresponding groups are sometimes not highlighted when clicking on entriesFixes [#3312](https://github.com/JabRef/jabref/issues/3112)
The cause of this bug is that the local variable ""pseudoClassState"" is garbaged by java gc. There is no reference to this variable except an weak one from ""bind"" function.
![peek 2018-10-24 18-21](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8992037/47424387-29cd2800-d7ba-11e8-8416-4410aa5a345a.gif)
Note: groups that autonatically created won't highlight at all
column2: for example the _tag_ group in above gif.  I think this shall be another issue.

column1: 4406springzfx8992037closed2018-10-24T15:16:37Z2018-10-25T19:51:51Z"fix ""save"" button in preference dialog not response""I notice there is a dark theme in recent commit. So I tried it
column2: and find out an issue that you can not save preference. ""Save"" button have no response. The issue starts from _Provide access to dark theme in preferences_ (https://github.com/JabRef/jabref/pull/4372).

column1: The reason is that default value for key ""fxTheme"" is not set
column2: thus cause a null exception when access this option. Solution is simple
column3: just to set default value ""Base.css"" for key ""fxTheme"" in preference.

column1: Finally
column2: I have to say dark theme is a great job. thanks

> ## Application Insights Java SDK 2.2.1
> Welcome to Application Insights Java SDK 2.2.1 and Application Insights SpringBoot Starter 1.1.1-BETA! This service release brings critical bug fixes and enhancement.
> Enhancements:
> 1. Added support for writing diagnostic logs to file for Application Insights Java Agent.
> 2. Added ability to configure FileLogger for SpringBootStarter.
> Deprecations:
> 1. Deprecated `InternalAgentLogger` in favor of `InternalLogger` for better consistency.

> - Fixed [#751](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/Microsoft/ApplicationInsights-Java/issues/751). Added support for absolute paths for log file output.
> - Abstracted Internal Logger in Core into separate reusable module.

> - Added ability to configure FileLogger for SpringBootStarter.

column1: 4503dependabot-preview[bot]27856297closed2018-11-21T05:41:08Z2018-11-21T07:57:59ZBump archunit-junit5-engine from 0.9.2 to 0.9.3"Bumps [archunit-junit5-engine](https://github.com/TNG/ArchUnit) from 0.9.2 to 0.9.3.
<details>
<summary>Release notes</summary>
*Sourced from [archunit-junit5-engine's releases](https://github.com/TNG/ArchUnit/releases).*
> ## ArchUnit 0.9.3
> # Bug Fixes

> Fixed memory leak in combination of the newly added `ArchRule.AssertionError` and JUnit 4. JUnit 4 keeps references to all thrown `AssertionErrors` through the whole run. Since `ArchRule.AssertionError` kept a reference to `EvaluationResult` this could consume a lot of memory
column2: if the respective results were big.

column1: > This release removes `ArchRule.AssertionError` (introduced in version 0.9.0).
> Note that this is in theory a **breaking change**
column2: since it would have been possible to catch and process `ArchRule.AssertionError`. There does not seem to be any clean solution to this problem though
column3: and due to the slim probability that the removal of this part of the API will in fact affect any user
column4: the step seems justified.

column1: > If anybody should against all odds have a problem with this
column2: feel free to open an issue and we will find a different solution.

column1: </details>

column1: [#4437]https://github.com/JabRef/jabref/issues/4437
Changed the sizes of buttons ""Update to current column widths"" and ""Update to current column order""
![screen shot 2018-12-05 at 11 23 39 pm](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/33430757/49594266-b549e500-f932-11e8-9129-3ef62c0beac6.png)
There is still more to fix in this issue:
The Field name is not editable
The value in Field name is not identical with table header
The title of the PR must not reference an issue
column2: because GitHub does not support autolinking there. -->

column1: - [ X ] Change in CHANGELOG.md described
- [ X ] Tests created for changes
- [ X ] Manually tested changed features in running JabRef
- [ X ] Screenshots added in PR description (for bigger UI changes)
- [ X ] Ensured that [the git commit message is a good one](https://github.com/joelparkerhenderson/git_commit_message)

<details>

> ## Application Insights Java SDK 2.3.0

> Welcome to Holiday Edition release of Application Insights Java SDK 2.3.0 and Application Insights SpringBoot Starter 1.1.1 (Release version)! This service release brings in brand new features and critical bug fixes.
> Enhancements:

> 1. Introduced support for [W3C Trace Context](https://w3c.github.io/trace-context/) Correlation Headers to support distributed tracing across Application Insights and [Open Census](https://opencensus.io) SDKs.
> 2. Introducing Application Insights SpringBoot Starter 1.1.1 (Release Version)!
> Bug Fixes:
> 1. Fix [#784](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/Microsoft/ApplicationInsights-Java/issues/784) Shade guava dependency.

- Added check in BibEntry to see if 'searchField' matches TYPE_HEADER - ""entrytype""
- Made change in WordKeywordGroup to collect entries for the entrytype groups

4578Siedlerchr320228closed2019-01-10T17:44:43Z2019-05-30T15:38:43Z[WIP] Drastically! Improve performance My first attempt at hacking the performance of JabRef at startup
I found out that JabRef sequentially loads the last edited files in the GUI thread.
Now I decided to load multiple databases in parallel and in a background task.
This drastically improves the startup performance.
This is currently more a good hack. But maybe @tobiasdiez  you have some ideas on how to make it fine.
Seems that I currently are stuck with an open thread at exiting JabRef

- at the end of parse method
column2: if no error has been spot
column3: epilog variable (which contains eventual remaining BibTex fragment ignored by the parser) is now 'regex'-checked to verify if there's still some relevant content in the form `<fieldName> = <content>

@tobiasdiez please validate this solution

column1: Created solution for suggested improvement described in [#4496](https://github.com/JabRef/jabref/issues/4496)
Adjusted BaseDialog class to watch for new KeyBinding combination (default: ctrl + ENTER). When such combination is pressed in any dialog which extends BaseDialog
column2: then system tries to find button with default action. If such button is found
column3: then its event is fired.

column1: Additional tests were not created as there currently is no BaseDialogTest test suite and existing dialog tests should cover the changes. In my opinion
column2: quite major refactoring should be made to easily create unit tests for BaseDialog class.

column1: Add the following autosave actions to your database:
@Comment{jabref-meta: databaseType:biblatex;}
@Comment{jabref-meta: saveActions:enabled;
date[normalize_date]
pages[normalize_page_numbers]
all-text-fields[latex_to_unicode]
title[html_to_unicode]
search for something and press <kbd>ctrl+space</kbd> to open autocomplete popup. Enter sth like \emph{dictionary} in the title field and press save.
No errros.

column1: 4653dependabot-preview[bot]27856297closed2019-02-12T07:26:35Z2019-02-12T09:32:55ZBump bcprov-jdk15on from 1.60 to 1.61"Bumps [bcprov-jdk15on](https://github.com/bcgit/bc-java) from 1.60 to 1.61.
<details>
<summary>Changelog</summary>
*Sourced from [bcprov-jdk15on's changelog](https://github.com/bcgit/bc-java/blob/master/docs/releasenotes.html).*
> <html>
> <head>
> <title>Bouncy Castle Crypto Package - Release Notes</title>
> </head>
> <body bgcolor=""#ffffff"" text=""#000000#"">
> <center>

>

Bouncy Castle Crypto Package - Release Notes
> <font size=1>
> <pre>
>
> </font>
> </center>

>

1.0 Introduction
> The Bouncy Castle Crypto package is a Java implementation of
> cryptographic algorithms.  The package is organised so that it
> contains a light-weight API suitable for use in any environment
> (including the J2ME) with the additional infrastructure
> to conform the algorithms to the JCE framework.

>

2.0 Release History

>

2.1.1 Version
> Release: 1.61
> Date:      2019
column2: February 4th.

column1:
>

2.1.2 Defects Fixed
> <ul>

>
  • Use of EC named curves could be lost if keys were constructed via a key factory and algorithm parameters. This has been fixed.

>
  • RFC3211WrapEngine would not properly handle messages longer than 127 bytes. This has been fixed.

>
  • The JCE implementations for RFC3211 would not return null AlgorithmParameters. This has been fixed.

>
  • TLS: Don't check CCS status for hello_request.

>
  • TLS: Tolerate unrecognized hash algorithms.

>
  • TLS: Tolerate unrecognized SNI types.

>
  • An incompatibility issue in ECIES-KEM encryption in cofactor mode has been fixed.

>
  • An issue with XMSS/XMSSMT private key loading which could result in invalid signatures has been fixed.

>
  • StateAwareSignature.isSigningCapable() now returns false when the key has reached it's maximum number of signatures.

>
  • The McEliece KeyPairGenerator was failing to initialize the underlying class if a SecureRandom was explicitly passed.

>
  • The McEliece cipher would sometimes report the wrong value on a call to Cipher.getOutputSize(int). This has been fixed.

>
  • CSHAKEDigest.leftEncode() was using the wrong endianness for multi byte values. This has been fixed.
> <li>Some ciphers
column2: such as CAST6
column3: were missing AlgorithmParameters implementations. This has been fixed.

column1:
>
  • An issue with the default ""m"" parameter for 1024 bit Diffie-Hellman keys which could result in an exception on key pair generation has been fixed.

>
  • The SPHINCS256 implementation is now more tolerant of parameters wrapped with a SecureRandom and will not throw an exception if it receives one.

>
  • A regression in PGPUtil.writeFileToLiteralData() which could cause corrupted literal data has been fixed.

>
  • Several parsing issues related to the processing of CMP PKIPublicationInfo have been fixed.

>
  • The ECGOST curves for id-tc26-gost-3410-12-256-paramSetA and id-tc26-gost-3410-12-512-paramSetC had incorrect co-factors. These have been fixed.

>

2.1.3 Additional Features and Functionality
> ... (truncated)
</details>
<details>
<summary>Commits</summary>
- See full diff in [compare view](https://github.com/bcgit/bc-java/commits)
</details>

column1: - Rework dialog in JavaFX
- Unify code for import (move everything from the old import dialog class to the import handler)
- Simply interface and reduce user-choices (in particular
column2: always generate bibtex keys)

column1: There are still a few todo's related to undo/redo functionality (which is a further huge PR). Moreover
column2: I'm not sure if I correctly transferred the handling of duplicated entries (the code was a bit hard to understand at some places).

column1: @MartinKarim Any suggestions to (further) improve the UI? I tried to highlight the entries which the user selected for import (by clicking the plus icon)
column2: but that looked ugly and was in conflict to mouse over and mouse clicked states of the list rows.

column1: Link issues by using the following pattern: [#333](https://github.com/JabRef/jabref/issues/333) or [koppor#49](https://github.com/koppor/jabref/issues/47).

column1: Removes the global search feature (i.e. list matched entries across all open libraries). Converting this dialog to JavaFX would mean a huge effort as the maintable would have to be refactored so that one can reuse the GUI-related logic. On the other hand
column2: I guess only a very small fraction of users are actually aware of this feature so it shouldn't be a huge loss (we have no telemetry data for this dialog as it was implemented slightly differently and didn't derived from JabRefDialog).

column1: @JabRef/developers any objections?

column1: As discussed in the devcall
column2: we might temporarily remove (or disable) some of the old Swing dialog instead of converting them directly to JavaFX. The ""Customize entry types"" dialog is one of these dialogs
column3: because it is not yet clear how entries should be displayed in the entry editor (especially how to group fields) and these decisions directly translate to changes to the customization dialog.

column1: After merging
column2: an issue for the re-implementation should be opened.

4717tobiasdiez5037600closed2019-03-03T20:38:27Z2019-03-29T21:00:26ZRemove ""plain text import"" feature""<!-- describe the changes you have made here: what
column2: why

column1: Link issues by using the following pattern: [#333](https://github.com/JabRef/jabref/issues/333) or [koppor#49](https://github.com/koppor/jabref/issues/47).
The title of the PR must not reference an issue
column2: because GitHub does not support autolinking there. -->

column1: Removes the ""plain text import"" dialog. Although I like the idea of the dialog
column2: our users simply do not use it. The azure telemetry shows only 35 interactions with the dialog in the past year. Moreover
column3: the dialog is currently broken (you cannot paste anything) and the git logs suggest that it's in this state now for over a year - but we have no user reports about this. Finally
column4: the re-implementation in JavaFX would be a huge effort
column5: which I'm not will to invest in view of the low usage numbers.

column1: I would suggest to re-implement some of the features (like automatic bibtex generation using freecite) at a later stage.

4726NorwayMaple21989062closed2019-03-06T12:49:42Z2019-03-08T17:59:45ZUse action handlerI found a problem in which the Add Group Dialog was processing text fields for each keystroke typed in them rather than when the user was done typing. This would throw errors when the user's partially-typed answer was invalid. I changed this by using `EventHandler`s instead of `Listener`s.
This may already have been fixed by the recent change to the dialog
column2: but this PR shouldn't hurt anyway
column3: since the fields will only be updated when the user is finished typing."11121651

column1: 4748dependabot-preview[bot]27856297closed2019-03-11T06:50:04Z2019-03-11T07:12:33ZBump guava from 27.0.1-jre to 27.1-jre"Bumps [guava](https://github.com/google/guava) from 27.0.1-jre to 27.1-jre.
<details>
<summary>Release notes</summary>
*Sourced from [guava's releases](https://github.com/google/guava/releases).*
> ### Maven
> ```xml
> <dependency>
>   <groupId>com.google.guava</groupId>
>   <artifactId>guava</artifactId>
>   <version>27.1-jre</version>

column2: for Android: -->

column1: >   <version>27.1-android</version>
> </dependency>
> ### Javadoc
> - [27.1-jre](http://google.github.io/guava/releases/27.1-jre/api/docs/)
> - [27.1-android](http://google.github.io/guava/releases/27.1-android/api/docs/)
> ### JDiff
> - [27.1-jre vs. 27.0.1-jre](http://google.github.io/guava/releases/27.1-jre/api/diffs/)
> - [27.1-android vs. 27.0.1-android](http://google.github.io/guava/releases/27.1-android/api/diffs/)
> - [27.1-android vs. 27.1-jre](http://google.github.io/guava/releases/27.1-android/api/androiddiffs/)
> ### Changelog
> - Removed GWT emulations that are no longer needed as of GWT 2.8.2. This means that GWT projects that use this version of Guava must use GWT 2.8.2 or higher. (5f3507252)
> - Created a BOM for Guava (new `guava-bom` artifact). (0e5964129)
> - Removed `[@​Beta](https://github.com/Beta)` from a number of frequently used APIs. (6242bdd27)
> - `net`: Added `Sec-Fetch` headers to `HttpHeaders`. (673b24376)
> - `net`: Added `SourceMap` header to `HttpHeaders` (a99c15f4c)
> - `net`: Added `MediaType` for ""application/jose"" and ""application/jose+json"". (d416e04cf)

> - `graph`: Added overloads to methods accepting pairs of nodes to also accept `EndpointPair`; changed behavior of `*Graph.edges().contains()` to allow undirected graphs to accept ordered `EndpointPair`s. (af3ee1c59)
</details>
<details>
<summary>Commits</summary>
- See full diff in [compare view](https://github.com/google/guava/commits)
</details>

4769CaptainDaVinci21019116closed2019-03-17T12:03:53Z2019-03-28T08:04:48ZFix removing entries when source-code-field is out of focusFixes #4764
The issue was
column2: `storeSource()` method is called when entry is out of focus
column3: however
column4: if another entry is selected then `currentEntry` is updated to that and `storeSource()` is called with the previous `codeArea` but updating it in the second entry
column5: thus causing a duplication.

column1: Fix was to pass the entry as another argument to `storeSource()`.

column1: 4773dependabot-preview[bot]27856297closed2019-03-18T05:44:41Z2019-03-18T07:34:05ZBump archunit-junit5-api from 0.9.3 to 0.10.1"Bumps [archunit-junit5-api](https://github.com/TNG/ArchUnit) from 0.9.3 to 0.10.1.
<details>
<summary>Release notes</summary>
*Sourced from [archunit-junit5-api's releases](https://github.com/TNG/ArchUnit/releases).*
> ## ArchUnit 0.10.1
> # Bug Fixes
> * `JavaPackage.PackageVisitor` and `JavaPackage.ClassVisitor` are now public instead of package-private to be usable as public API
> ## ArchUnit 0.10.0
> # Breaking Changes
> * The deprecated method `String JavaClass.getPackage()` was replaced by `JavaPackage JavaClass.getPackage()`. To query the package name
column2: please use `String JavaClass.getPackageName()`.

column1: > * The deprecated method `JavaClass.getDirectDependencies()` has been removed -> use `JavaClass.getDirectDependenciesFromSelf()` instead
> * The deprecated field `JavaClass.Functions.SIMPLE_NAME` has been removed
column2: please use `JavaClass.Functions.GET_SIMPLE_NAME`

column1: > # New Deprecation

> * ArchUnit does not use contractions anymore within the rules API. So far many methods were phrased like `dontHave...()` instead of `doNotHave...()`. In general this seems to be more trouble than worth it and does not read that well without an apostrophe
column2: so all those methods were declared deprecated and have a new counter part without the contraction. A simple search & replace of `dont` by `doNot` should fix all those deprecations.

column1: > * Some methods were deprecated because they were not precise enough
column2: if generics come into play. For example `JavaClass JavaField.getType()` is not precise enough
column3: because the type of a field is something else than a `JavaClass` (like `T someField` or `List<? extends T> someField`). Thus all those methods have been deprecated to make room for a future extension with generics and instead got a new version explicitly stating that the ""raw type"" is meant. For example `JavaField.getType()` -> `JavaField.getRawType()`
column4: `JavaMethod.getParameters()` -> `JavaMethod.getRawParameterTypes()`.

column1: > * `Formatters.formatLocation(JavaClass
column2: lineNumber)` was deprecated in favor of the newly introduced `SourceCodeLocation.of(JavaClass
column3: lineNumber)` which will report the correct location (i.e. link for IDEs) via `toString()`

column1: > # Enhancements
> ## Core
> * The default class resolution behavior for classes missing from the import was changed. Before by default missing classes were replaced by stubs
column2: now by default they will be resolved from the classpath. Compare the [user guide](https://www.archunit.org/userguide/html/000_Index.html#_dealing_with_missing_classes) (see [#111](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/TNG/ArchUnit/issues/111))

column1: > * `JavaClass` can now be queried for declared throws clauses
column2: any `Throwables` declared on methods or constructors count as dependencies of a `JavaClass` (see [#126](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/TNG/ArchUnit/issues/126); thanks a lot to [@​tngwoerleij](https://github.com/tngwoerleij))

column1: > * `JavaClass` can now be queried if it is an array (see [#114](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/TNG/ArchUnit/issues/114); thanks a lot to [@​wengertj](https://github.com/wengertj))
> * The resolution of classes from the classpath will now use the context `ClassLoader` if set (should usually not make any difference
column2: but allows to control the `ClassLoader` used by ArchUnit for class resolution)

column1: > * `JavaClass` now has a more sophisticated `JavaPackage` attached to it. It is also possible to retrieve any `JavaPackage` from `JavaClasses`. `JavaPackage` offers a more convenient API for dependencies between packages (see [#158](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/TNG/ArchUnit/issues/158); thanks a lot to [@​goetzd](https://github.com/goetzd) for reviewing and user guide adjustment)
> * For arrays `JavaClass.getPackageName()` now returns the package of the component type instead of empty. While empty is closer to the Java Reflection API
column2: it is not really useful from a point of view of dependencies. Using an array of a type in a package should cause a dependency to that package (see [#161](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/TNG/ArchUnit/issues/161))

column1: > ## Lang

> * The rules API now provides an extensive support for checks of members / methods / fields (see [#38](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/TNG/ArchUnit/issues/38); thanks a lot to [@​hankem](https://github.com/hankem) for an extensive review and many improvements)
> ## Library

> * It is now possible to create a `CompositeArchRule` from several `ArchRules` to check multiple rules at once (see [#78](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/TNG/ArchUnit/issues/78); thanks a lot to [@​bogsi17](https://github.com/bogsi17))
> * The PlantUML rules API now understands more types of arrows (description on arrows
column2: arrows from right to left
column3: arrow colors)
column4: compare the [user guide](https://www.archunit.org/userguide/html/000_Index.html#_plantuml_component_diagrams_as_rules) (see [#135](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/TNG/ArchUnit/issues/135))

column1: > * New predefined rule to avoid the use of `org.joda.time` in favor of the `java.time` API (see [#145](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/TNG/ArchUnit/issues/145); thanks a lot to [@​sullis](https://github.com/sullis))

> * The slices API is now more configurable to deal with inconsistent package structures and legacy projects. It is now possible to customize the assignment of `JavaClasses` to `Slices` by a simple function `JavaClass` -> `Identifier`
column2: compare the [user guide](https://www.archunit.org/userguide/html/000_Index.html#_slices) (see [#156](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/TNG/ArchUnit/issues/156))

column1: > ## JUnit
> * The JUnit 5 platform dependency has been upgraded to version `1.4.0`.
> # Further Acknowledgement
> * Thanks a lot to [@​alanktwong](https://github.com/alanktwong) for improving the CONTRIBUTING docs on how to build the project
> * Thanks a lot to [@​wengertj](https://github.com/wengertj) for removing use of deprecated Gradle API
> * Thanks a lot to [@​olleolleolle](https://github.com/olleolleolle) for replacing the PNG build badge by SVG
> * Thanks a lot to [@​sullis](https://github.com/sullis) for updating the Travis build to use OpenJDK 11
> ... (truncated)
</details>
<details>
<summary>Commits</summary>

- [`6fab823`](https://github.com/TNG/ArchUnit/commit/6fab823264c36700642f4cc8326e0ac646033b11) Fix API -> Parameters PackageVisitor and ClassVisitor must be public. Also ad...
- [`8208535`](https://github.com/TNG/ArchUnit/commit/820853540a68d2a642f1b2334ac4f34265907e5d) Adjusted user guide

column1: - [`7f5768a`](https://github.com/TNG/ArchUnit/commit/7f5768a809d3101da2e6b742998f57cbc770ff35) Prepare release 0.10.0
- [`f4a4320`](https://github.com/TNG/ArchUnit/commit/f4a43204609d44018421055d7996a6918ce2ed88) Update docs for release 0.10.0
- [`957b514`](https://github.com/TNG/ArchUnit/commit/957b5146cc564278c8d4610afa2f027b8eb4384b) Upgraded JUnit Jupiter and Platform dependencies to current version

column1: 4777dependabot-preview[bot]27856297closed2019-03-18T05:45:14Z2019-03-18T09:51:02ZBump archunit-junit5-engine from 0.9.3 to 0.10.1"Bumps [archunit-junit5-engine](https://github.com/TNG/ArchUnit) from 0.9.3 to 0.10.1.
<details>
<summary>Release notes</summary>
*Sourced from [archunit-junit5-engine's releases](https://github.com/TNG/ArchUnit/releases).*
> ## ArchUnit 0.10.1
> # Bug Fixes
> * `JavaPackage.PackageVisitor` and `JavaPackage.ClassVisitor` are now public instead of package-private to be usable as public API
> ## ArchUnit 0.10.0
> # Breaking Changes
> * The deprecated method `String JavaClass.getPackage()` was replaced by `JavaPackage JavaClass.getPackage()`. To query the package name
column2: please use `String JavaClass.getPackageName()`.

column1: > * The deprecated method `JavaClass.getDirectDependencies()` has been removed -> use `JavaClass.getDirectDependenciesFromSelf()` instead
> * The deprecated field `JavaClass.Functions.SIMPLE_NAME` has been removed
column2: please use `JavaClass.Functions.GET_SIMPLE_NAME`

column1: > # New Deprecation

> * ArchUnit does not use contractions anymore within the rules API. So far many methods were phrased like `dontHave...()` instead of `doNotHave...()`. In general this seems to be more trouble than worth it and does not read that well without an apostrophe
column2: so all those methods were declared deprecated and have a new counter part without the contraction. A simple search & replace of `dont` by `doNot` should fix all those deprecations.

column1: > * Some methods were deprecated because they were not precise enough
column2: if generics come into play. For example `JavaClass JavaField.getType()` is not precise enough
column3: because the type of a field is something else than a `JavaClass` (like `T someField` or `List<? extends T> someField`). Thus all those methods have been deprecated to make room for a future extension with generics and instead got a new version explicitly stating that the ""raw type"" is meant. For example `JavaField.getType()` -> `JavaField.getRawType()`
column4: `JavaMethod.getParameters()` -> `JavaMethod.getRawParameterTypes()`.

column1: > * `Formatters.formatLocation(JavaClass
column2: lineNumber)` was deprecated in favor of the newly introduced `SourceCodeLocation.of(JavaClass
column3: lineNumber)` which will report the correct location (i.e. link for IDEs) via `toString()`

column1: > # Enhancements
> ## Core
> * The default class resolution behavior for classes missing from the import was changed. Before by default missing classes were replaced by stubs
column2: now by default they will be resolved from the classpath. Compare the [user guide](https://www.archunit.org/userguide/html/000_Index.html#_dealing_with_missing_classes) (see [#111](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/TNG/ArchUnit/issues/111))

column1: > * `JavaClass` can now be queried for declared throws clauses
column2: any `Throwables` declared on methods or constructors count as dependencies of a `JavaClass` (see [#126](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/TNG/ArchUnit/issues/126); thanks a lot to [@​tngwoerleij](https://github.com/tngwoerleij))

column1: > * `JavaClass` can now be queried if it is an array (see [#114](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/TNG/ArchUnit/issues/114); thanks a lot to [@​wengertj](https://github.com/wengertj))
> * The resolution of classes from the classpath will now use the context `ClassLoader` if set (should usually not make any difference
column2: but allows to control the `ClassLoader` used by ArchUnit for class resolution)

column1: > * `JavaClass` now has a more sophisticated `JavaPackage` attached to it. It is also possible to retrieve any `JavaPackage` from `JavaClasses`. `JavaPackage` offers a more convenient API for dependencies between packages (see [#158](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/TNG/ArchUnit/issues/158); thanks a lot to [@​goetzd](https://github.com/goetzd) for reviewing and user guide adjustment)
> * For arrays `JavaClass.getPackageName()` now returns the package of the component type instead of empty. While empty is closer to the Java Reflection API
column2: it is not really useful from a point of view of dependencies. Using an array of a type in a package should cause a dependency to that package (see [#161](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/TNG/ArchUnit/issues/161))

column1: > ## Lang

> * The rules API now provides an extensive support for checks of members / methods / fields (see [#38](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/TNG/ArchUnit/issues/38); thanks a lot to [@​hankem](https://github.com/hankem) for an extensive review and many improvements)
> ## Library

> * It is now possible to create a `CompositeArchRule` from several `ArchRules` to check multiple rules at once (see [#78](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/TNG/ArchUnit/issues/78); thanks a lot to [@​bogsi17](https://github.com/bogsi17))
> * The PlantUML rules API now understands more types of arrows (description on arrows
column2: arrows from right to left
column3: arrow colors)
column4: compare the [user guide](https://www.archunit.org/userguide/html/000_Index.html#_plantuml_component_diagrams_as_rules) (see [#135](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/TNG/ArchUnit/issues/135))

column1: > * New predefined rule to avoid the use of `org.joda.time` in favor of the `java.time` API (see [#145](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/TNG/ArchUnit/issues/145); thanks a lot to [@​sullis](https://github.com/sullis))

> * The slices API is now more configurable to deal with inconsistent package structures and legacy projects. It is now possible to customize the assignment of `JavaClasses` to `Slices` by a simple function `JavaClass` -> `Identifier`
column2: compare the [user guide](https://www.archunit.org/userguide/html/000_Index.html#_slices) (see [#156](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/TNG/ArchUnit/issues/156))

column1: > ## JUnit
> * The JUnit 5 platform dependency has been upgraded to version `1.4.0`.
> # Further Acknowledgement
> * Thanks a lot to [@​alanktwong](https://github.com/alanktwong) for improving the CONTRIBUTING docs on how to build the project
> * Thanks a lot to [@​wengertj](https://github.com/wengertj) for removing use of deprecated Gradle API
> * Thanks a lot to [@​olleolleolle](https://github.com/olleolleolle) for replacing the PNG build badge by SVG
> * Thanks a lot to [@​sullis](https://github.com/sullis) for updating the Travis build to use OpenJDK 11
> ... (truncated)
</details>
<details>
<summary>Commits</summary>
- [`aa96f5b`](https://github.com/TNG/ArchUnit/commit/aa96f5b00f34e51ab9739f0a77ee36e920156779) Update versions for new release 0.10.1
- [`6fab823`](https://github.com/TNG/ArchUnit/commit/6fab823264c36700642f4cc8326e0ac646033b11) Fix API -> Parameters PackageVisitor and ClassVisitor must be public. Also ad...
- [`8208535`](https://github.com/TNG/ArchUnit/commit/820853540a68d2a642f1b2334ac4f34265907e5d) Adjusted user guide
column2: surefire-plugin 2.22.0 actually works without the provid...

column1: - [`7f5768a`](https://github.com/TNG/ArchUnit/commit/7f5768a809d3101da2e6b742998f57cbc770ff35) Prepare release 0.10.0
- [`f4a4320`](https://github.com/TNG/ArchUnit/commit/f4a43204609d44018421055d7996a6918ce2ed88) Update docs for release 0.10.0
- [`957b514`](https://github.com/TNG/ArchUnit/commit/957b5146cc564278c8d4610afa2f027b8eb4384b) Upgraded JUnit Jupiter and Platform dependencies to current version

column1: Fixes issue [#4736](https://github.com/JabRef/jabref/issues/4736)
Changes:
1. Introduced a new `LaTexFileDirectory` to MetaData.java
2. The path of the aux file is now serialized as a relative path with respect to the `LaTexFileDirectory`
3. The `getFilePath()` of TexGroup now returns the relative path of the aux file used to create the group.
4. Each user can define their own `LaTexFileDirectory` similar to `userFileDirectory`
5. I have implemented tests to check for basic parsing/serialization and also to check that the relative path is being found correctly.
6. When user selects an aux file via the browse button
column2: they are shown the relative path of the file in `texGroupFilePath` in Group Dialog.

4797deepakkumar9617297948closed2019-03-21T15:29:17Z2019-04-13T15:50:24ZFix right clicking on any entry and selecting ""Open folder"" results in the NullPointer exception""Fixes #4763
The issue was when a user right-clicks an entry and right click ""open folder""  then it results in Null Pointer Exception in Linux System.
The main cause for this issue was in the Linux implementation of NativeDesktop(Linux.java#openFolderAndSelectFile)
column2: that code looks for

column1: an environment variable named 'DESKTOP_SESSION' and if this variable is not set in any system then it will result in Null Pointer Exception.
The Fix was to check if 'DESKTOP_SESSION' variable is present or not
column2: if not present then run a default command which will try to open the folder.

column1: Another issue was that if a system does not have a file browser installed then right-clicking on any entry and selecting ""open folder"" option will not do anything(if there is no file browser installed in the system).
To fix this issue I've added an option in preference setting window to set command or program for default file browser
column2: where a user can explicitly set command or let JefRef use a default behavior like this:

column1: Fixes issue [#4679](https://github.com/JabRef/jabref/issues/4679)
This PR fixes the first issue. I could not reproduce the second issue. The item count should now be updated correctly.

The problem was because of the Listener not getting notified when changes were being made. This was due to the weak listener which was attached to ObservableList returned by `databaseContext.getDatabase().getEntries()`.
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/44341400/whats-the-purpose-of-fxcollections-unmodifiableobservablelist

The only case where this PR might not work is when we are dealing with a library in which there are no groups other than the All Entries [#4441](https://github.com/JabRef/jabref/issues/4441). That is because the group being utilized in the line `text.textProperty().bind(group.getHits().asString());` in file /gui/groups/GroupTreeView.java is the group All Entries that is present even before you open any library in JabRef. This causes value to not be set properly. But the only time it happens is if the only group you have in the new library is All Entries. Once we are able to fix that
column2: this PR should work in all cases.

4815r0light24212145closed2019-03-27T14:54:52Z2019-04-03T09:19:04ZEnhanced message logWorked on  [#4805](https://github.com/JabRef/jabref/issues/4805) .
Removed JabRefFrame.output in favor of FXDialogService.notify and refactored calling code.
Added Logging to FXDialogService.notify
Logs seemed to be duplicated afterwards. However
column2: this was another issue with log4j. Because LogEvent-Objects are reused
column3: they were copied in LogMessages.add . But at that point it was too late
column4: resulting in different Log Messages being overwritten. I therefore moved the copying to GuiAppender.append and this resolves the issue of seemingly duplicated log messages.

column1: This is probably also the reason for [#4811](https://github.com/JabRef/jabref/issues/4811)
closes #4805 closes #4811

column1: I found the following. During serialization
column2: the group string is quoted twice
column3: once when it is being serialized to the group string in class `org.jabref.logic.exporter.GroupSerializer`
column4: and once when the group string is being combined with other metadata in `org.jabref.logic.exporter.MetaDataSerializer`
column5: hence 2^2 = 4 quotes in the database after saving. It is also unquoted twice
column6: once when the group string is being separated from the metadata string in method `getNextUnit` in class `org.jabref.logic.importer.MetaDataParser`
column7: and again in `org.jabref.logic.importer.GroupParser` in each of the `...fromString` methods using `StringUtil.unquote`. However
column8: it is also unquoted a third time (between the other two) in `QuotedStringTokenizer`. `QuotedStringTokenizer` splits the group into parts
column9: which are then given back to `GroupsParser` and unquoted using `StringUtil.unquote`. The change I made allows `QuotedStringTokenizer` only to split the parts of the group string

4832dependabot-preview[bot]27856297closed2019-04-01T05:59:09Z2019-04-01T06:26:20ZBump archunit-junit5-engine from 0.10.1 to 0.10.2Bumps [archunit-junit5-engine](https://github.com/TNG/ArchUnit) from 0.10.1 to 0.10.2.
<details>
<summary>Release notes</summary>
*Sourced from [archunit-junit5-engine's releases](https://github.com/TNG/ArchUnit/releases).*
> ## ArchUnit 0.10.2
> # Bug Fixes

> * Fixed `JavaPackage.getPackageDependenciesFromSelf()` containing the package itself if there was a dependency in the same package but not directly imported (e.g. `importer.importClasses(Foo.class)` where `some.pkg.Foo` would depend on `some.pkg.Bar`
column2: which was not imported)

column1: > # Enhancements
> ## Core
> * Some methods now return `Collection` types instead of `Iterable` to integrate nicer with streams
> ## Lang
> * `FieldsShould` now contains the negation `notHaveRawTypes` (see [#162](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/TNG/ArchUnit/issues/162); thanks a lot to [@​asbachb](https://github.com/asbachb))
> * `CodeUnitsShould` now contains the negations `notHaveRawParameterTypes`
column2: `notHaveRawReturnType` and `notDeclareThrowableOfType`

column1: > * The syntax now contains `{methods
column2: fields}().should().{be
column3: notBe}{Static
column4: Final}` (see [#164](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/TNG/ArchUnit/issues/164); thanks a lot to [@​hankem](https://github.com/hankem))

column1: > ## Library
> * `Slice` now also offers `dependenciesToSelf` additionally to `dependenciesFromSelf`
> # Further Acknowledgement
> * Thanks a lot to [@​hankem](https://github.com/hankem) for reviewing and improving the user guide
</details>

column1: 4855r0light24212145closed2019-04-05T07:55:04Z2019-04-18T18:48:53ZImprove full text search for several files"Solution proposal for #4854
In `FindFullTextAction`
column2: `Task` is now used instead of `BackgroundTask` to be able to show a progress dialog which shows the progress for searching files online.

column1: ![lookupDialog](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/24212145/55612578-cabc0800-5788-11e9-92b4-ec4081977b7d.PNG)
Furthermore
column2: the functionality for downloading a file in `LinkedFileViewModel` is split into `download` and `prepareDownloadTask` to be able to define a custom onSucess-action for the background task. This is used in `FindFullTextAction` to add the downloaded file to the entry instead of the URL.

column1: The functionality provided by `LinkedFileViewModel.dowload` remains as it is
column2: so it does not affect the download of a single file via the EntryEditor.

column1: - [ ] Change in CHANGELOG.md described

- [x] Screenshots added in PR description (for bigger UI changes)

- [ ] Check documentation status (Issue created for outdated help page at [help.jabref.org](https://github.com/JabRef/help.jabref.org/issues)?)

Within JabRefPreferences.java we updated the MAIN_DEFAULT_SIZE to 12 and updated the OVERRIDE_DEFAULT_FONT_SIZE to true. This was to set the font size in accordance with ISO 9241-303. There are currently some truncating going on but the bounds remain the same.

column1: 4871tobiasdiez5037600closed2019-04-08T19:58:17Z2019-04-13T16:33:15ZPost change notifications on JavaFX"Fixes #4817. The problem is that changes in other threads produce a ""Not on FX application thread"" exception. This is fixed by adding a wrapper around the list of entries. The wrapper only posts changes in the correct thread
column2: without making a copy of the underlying list - so performance shouldn't be affected.

Fixes #4873
The only problem I now have
column2: I can't reliable detect/prevent dupliacte Strings

column1: e.g. A User can have a String with label a and content b
column2: and a User can enter a new String a  with content c

column1: The first String would now be overwritten.
@tobiasdiez  Do you have an idea if we can directly prevent the entering of duplicates?
The addAll method simply adds all strings and updates the content
column2: if found. Previously it would always report a duplicate label exception.

column1: Maybe one could check the ID value if it's present or equals.

<details>
<summary>Release notes</summary>
*Sourced from [richtextfx's releases](https://github.com/FXMisc/RichTextFX/releases).*
> This release features multi-release JAR files that are compatible with Java 8 and UP without the need for `add-exports` or `add-opens` JVM arguments.
> **Note** that you still need to include the JAR files on the classpath irrespective of the Java version being used.
> See the [Changelog](https://github.com/FXMisc/RichTextFX/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#v0100-2019-04-18)
</details>
<details>
<summary>Changelog</summary>
*Sourced from [richtextfx's changelog](https://github.com/FXMisc/RichTextFX/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md).*

> [Full Changelog](https://github.com/FXMisc/RichTextFX/compare/v0.9.3...v0.10.0)
> **Implemented enhancements:**
> - RichTextFX with Java 11 [\#776](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/FXMisc/RichTextFX/issues/776)
> **Fixed bugs:**
> - Bug: Lines sometimes overlap when one wraps by a small amount [\#809](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/FXMisc/RichTextFX/issues/809)

> - Fix bug: Fix height paragraph box height calculation [\#810](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/FXMisc/RichTextFX/pull/810) ([Chris Smith](https://github.com/csmith))
</details>

column1: What started as a simple fix for #4923
column2: quickly turned in an almost rewrite of the preview logic. Sorry for the large diff.

column1: The biggest change consists in the introduction of  the `PreviewLayout` interface
column2: with the two implementations based on JabRefs layout mechanism or using citation styles. This made it possible to handle these both cases on equal footing
column3: simplifying much of the logic.

<details>
<summary>Changelog</summary>
*Sourced from [jsoup's changelog](https://github.com/jhy/jsoup/blob/master/CHANGES).*
> jsoup changelog
> **** Release 1.12.2 [PENDING]
>   * Change: removed deprecated method to disable TLS cert checking Connection.validateTLSCertificates().
>   * Change: some internal methods have been rearranged; if you extended any of the Jsoup internals you may need to make
>     updates.
>   * Improvement: documents now remember their parser
column2: so when later manipulating them
column3: the correct HTML or XML tree

column1: >     builder is reused
column2: as are the parser settings like case preservation.

column1: >     <https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/jhy/jsoup/issues/769>
>   * Improvement: Jsoup now detects the character set of the input if specified in an XML Declaration
column2: when using the

column1: >     HTML parser. Previously that only happened when the XML parser was specified.
>     <https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/jhy/jsoup/issues/1009>
>   * Improvement: if the document's input character set does not support encoding
column2: flip it to one that does.

column1: >     <https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/jhy/jsoup/issues/1007>
>   * Improvement: if a start tag is missing a > and a new tag is seen with a <
column2: treat that as a new tag. (This differs

column1: >     from the HTML5 spec
column2: which would make at attribute with a name beginning with <
column3: but in practice this impacts too

column1: >     many pages.
>     <https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/jhy/jsoup/issues/797>
>   * Improvement: performance tweaks when parsing start tags
column2: data
column3: tables.

column1: >   * Improvement: added Element.nextElementSiblings() and Element.previousElementSiblings()
>     <https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/jhy/jsoup/pull/1054>
>   * Improvement: treat center tags as block tags.
>     <https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/jhy/jsoup/pull/1113>
>   * Improvement: allow forms to be submitted with Content-Type=multipart/form-data without requiring a file upload;
>     automatically set the mime boundary.
>     <https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/jhy/jsoup/pull/1058>
>   * Improvement: Jsoup will now detect if an input file or URL is binary
column2: and will refuse to attempt to parse it
column3: with

column1: >     an IO exception. This prevents runaway processing time and wasted effort creating meaningless parsed DOM trees.
>     <https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/jhy/jsoup/issues/1192>
>   * Bugfix: when using the tag case preserving parsing settings
column2: certain HTML tree building rules where not followed

column1: >     for upper case tags.
>     <https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/jhy/jsoup/issues/1149>
>   * Bugfix: when converting a Jsoup document to a W3C DOM
column2: if an element is namespaced but not in a defined namespace

column1: >     set it to the global namespace.

<details>
<summary>Changelog</summary>
*Sourced from [tika-core's changelog](https://github.com/apache/tika/blob/master/CHANGES.txt).*
> Release 2.0.0 - ???
>    BREAKING CHANGES in 2.0.0
>    * Remove deprecated Metadata keys/properties (TIKA-1974).
>    Other changes
> Release 1.21 - ????
>    * Add optional AUTO mode to OCR'ing of PDFs.  If tesseract is installed
>      and on the path
column2: and this option is selected programmatically

column1: >      or via TikaConfig()
column2: the PDFParser will use heuristics to decide

column1: >      whether or not to run OCR per page on PDFs. (TIKA-2749)
>    * The ZipContainerDetector's default behavior was changed to run
>      streaming detection up to its markLimit.  Users can get the
>      legacy behavior (spool-to-file/rely-on-underlying-file-in-TikaInputStream)
>      by setting markLimit=-1. The POIFSContainerDetector requires an underlying file;
>      it will try to spool the file to disk; if the file's length is > markLimit
>      it will not attempt detection; set markLimit to -1 for legacy behavior (TIKA-2849).
>    * Upgrade PDFBox to 2.0.14 (TIKA-2834).
>    * Add CSV detection and replace TXTParser with TextAndCSVParser;
>      users can turn off CSV detection by excluding the TextAndCSVParser
>      and adding back the TXTParser via tika-config (TIKA-2833).
>    * Add a CSVParser.  CSV detection is currently based solely on filename
>      and/or information conveyed via Metadata (TIKA-2826).
>    * General upgrades: asm
column2: bouncycastle
column3: commons-codec
column4: commons-lang3
column5: cxf

column1: >      guava

column1: >    * Bundle xerces2 with tika-parsers (TIKA-2802).
>    * Upgrade jaxb to 2.3.2 (TIKA-2819).
>    * Upgrade jackson to 2.9.8 (TIKA-2717).
>    * Update tika-eval's common tokens lists (TIKA-2822).
>    * Handle bad tags in tika-eval more robustly (TIKA-2810).
>    * Add reports for tags in tika-eval (TIKA-2809).
>    * Extract text from SDT element within textboxes in .docx files (TIKA-2807).
>    * Try to handle truncated OOXML files more robustly (TIKA-2765).
> ... (truncated)

column1: 4989dependabot-preview[bot]27856297closed2019-05-21T05:55:17Z2019-05-21T06:56:08ZBump richtextfx from 0.10.0 to 0.10.1"Bumps [richtextfx](https://github.com/FXMisc/RichTextFX) from 0.10.0 to 0.10.1.
<details>
<summary>Release notes</summary>
*Sourced from [richtextfx's releases](https://github.com/FXMisc/RichTextFX/releases).*
> This release also has multi-release JAR files that are compatible with Java 8 and UP without the need for `add-exports` or `add-opens` JVM arguments.
> **Note** that you still need to include the JAR files on the classpath irrespective of the Java version being used.
> See the [Changelog](https://github.com/FXMisc/RichTextFX/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#v0101-2019-05-20)
> **Note** All deprecated methods and properties have been removed in this release !
</details>
<details>
<summary>Changelog</summary>
*Sourced from [richtextfx's changelog](https://github.com/FXMisc/RichTextFX/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md).*

> [Full Changelog](https://github.com/FXMisc/RichTextFX/compare/v0.10.0...v0.10.1)

> - Changed page up and down behaviour [\#688](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/FXMisc/RichTextFX/issues/688)
> - Remove deprecated methods [\#818](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/FXMisc/RichTextFX/issues/818)
> **Fixed bugs:**

> - Bug: Undo after deleting styled text causes exception [\#815](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/FXMisc/RichTextFX/issues/815)
> **Merged pull requests:**

> - Fix bug: Fix Paragraph returning incorrectly styled subsequence [\#817](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/FXMisc/RichTextFX/pull/817) ([Jugen](https://github.com/Jugen))

> - Fix bug: Fix for [#812](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/FXMisc/RichTextFX/issues/812) caretBounds graphic bug [\#819 and [\#822](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/FXMisc/RichTextFX/issues/822)](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/FXMisc/RichTextFX/pull/819) ([Jugen](https://github.com/Jugen))

5010Siedlerchr320228closed2019-05-30T16:24:19Z2019-09-09T20:05:35Z[WIP] Fix field formatter save actions throwing exception on autosave"Fixes #4958
In my opinion this is an ugly hack but still the only option without violating our architecture.
Problem is that the autocompleter has an input binding which is triggered whenever setField in BibEntry is called
column2: in this case part of the apply save actions.

column1: On autosave we have a Background thread in the BackupoManager which executes the saveDatabaseAction which itself executes the save actions.
Exectuted in a background thread:
https://github.com/JabRef/jabref/blob/e83680f18d815ebebc779d239a6eacd8930150fe/src/main/java/org/jabref/logic/autosaveandbackup/BackupManager.java#L120-L124
https://github.com/JabRef/jabref/blob/e83680f18d815ebebc779d239a6eacd8930150fe/src/main/java/org/jabref/logic/exporter/BibDatabaseWriter.java#L170-L177

5025ms111ds38050737closed2019-06-03T00:01:32Z2019-06-09T06:07:06ZAdd warning for empty BibTeX keys in entry editorAdded a warning for empty BibTeX keys in entry editor.  Fixes #4440
A request came in to have the entry editor provide a warning when the BibTeX key field is empty. In order to make the warning icon appear
column2: 2 changes were necessary.

column1: **1 - Added new key value pair to multi map in FieldCheckers:** To check for a valid BibTex key in the entry editor
column2: the FieldCheckers object had the following key - value pair in its multimap

column1: ( FieldName.KEY
column2: ValidBibtexKeyChecker object )
column3: where FieldName.KEY is the string ""key"".

column1: When the BibtexKeyEditorViewModel tries to actually run this check
column2: they key it provides to the FieldCheckers instance is BibEntry.KEY_FIELD (""bibtexkey"") instead of FieldName.KEY (""key""). To accommodate for this
column3: BibEntry.KEY_FIELD was added to the FieldCheckers multimap.

column1: **2 - Added null and empty string check in ValidBibtexKeyChecker.checkValue():** Fixing the first issue caused an error to come arise in BibtexKeyGenerator.cleanKey() when called by ValidBibtexKeyChecker.checkValue(). This error was due to null strings being fed into BibtexKeyGenerator.cleanKey(). To fix this
column2: a check for null or zero length strings was added. This check also returned the ""empty BibTex key"" message.

column1: **Note:** an issue with the fix is that while it does create the ""empty BibTeX key"" warning
column2: the ""Invalid BibTeX key"" warning is pushed down. Pictures of this issue are attached.

> <html>
> <head>
> <title>Bouncy Castle Crypto Package - Release Notes</title>
> </head>
> <body bgcolor=""#ffffff"" text=""[#000000](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/bcgit/bc-java/issues/000000)#"">
> <center>

>

Bouncy Castle Crypto Package - Release Notes
> <font size=1>
> <pre>
>
> </font>
> </center>

>

1.0 Introduction
> The Bouncy Castle Crypto package is a Java implementation of
> cryptographic algorithms.  The package is organised so that it
> contains a light-weight API suitable for use in any environment
> (including the J2ME) with the additional infrastructure
> to conform the algorithms to the JCE framework.

>

2.0 Release History

>

2.1.1 Version
> Release: 1.62
> Date:      2019
column2: June 3rd.

column1:
>

2.1.2 Defects Fixed
> <ul>

>
  • DTLS: Fixed infinite loop on IO exceptions.

>
  • DTLS: Retransmission timers now properly apply to flights monolithically.

>
  • BCJSSE: setEnabledCipherSuites ignores unsupported cipher suites.

>
  • BCJSSE: SSLSocket implementations store passed-in 'host' before connecting.

>
  • BCJSSE: Handle SSLEngine closure prior to handshake.

>
  • EdDSA verifiers now reject overly long signatures.

>
  • XMSS/XMSS^MT OIDs now using the values defined in RFC 8391.

>
  • XMSS/XMSS^MT keys now encoded with OID at start.

>
  • An error causing valid paths to be rejected due to DN based name constraints has been fixed in the CertPath API.

>
  • Name constraint resolution now includes special handling of serial numbers.

>
  • Cipher implementations now handle ByteBuffer usage where the ByteBuffer has no backing array.

>
  • CertificateFactory now enforces presence of PEM headers when required.

>
  • A performance issue with RSA key pair generation that was introduced in 1.61 has been mostly eliminated.

>

2.1.3 Additional Features and Functionality
> <ul>

>
  • Builders for X509 certificates and CRLs now support replace and remove extension methods.

>
  • DTLS: Added server-side support for HelloVerifyRequest.

>
  • DTLS: Added support for an overall handshake timeout.

>
  • DTLS: Added support for the heartbeat extension (RFC 6520).
> ... (truncated)
</details>

<summary>Commits</summary>

Remove old dialog

Now it looks like this:
![grafik](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/320228/59150373-ac8db500-8a22-11e9-8e77-25f317fe9d8e.png)
Before:

This looks oddly familiar. I remember that this was having to do with the subscribers and the event bus system.

> Exiting an application
Unirest starts a background event loop and your Java application won't be able to exit until you manually shutdown all the threads by invoking:
Unirest.shutdown();
Maybe worth a try?"005011

5057Siedlerchr320228closed2019-06-15T19:37:32Z2019-06-16T09:47:13ZRemove BindingsHelper for UI in MainTableDataModelFixes #5036
The problem is that the Maintable findentry() method does not find the new entry.
Further debugging showed that the Observable List with the entries in the maintable model does not yet include the new inserted entry
column2: although it's already in the bib database.

column1: This is because due to the Bindings.forUI around the list in MainTable
column2: it's run on the FX thread. And the FX thread is blocked/busy with the findEntry method.

column1: I know this was added because of not on fx thread exceptions. But I tested cleanup and external modification of file and it was fine. I think the key problem was the old swing stuff at that time.

*Sourced from [postgresql's changelog](https://github.com/pgjdbc/pgjdbc/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md).*
> ### Known issues
> - Microseconds in timestamps might be truncated when transferred in binary mode
> - 24:00 time handling is not consistent [issue 1385](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/pgjdbc/pgjdbc/issues/1385)
> - Unexpected packet type during stream replication [issue 1466](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/pgjdbc/pgjdbc/issues/1466)
> - Driver goes missing after OSGi bundle restart [issue 1476](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/pgjdbc/pgjdbc/issues/1476)
> ### Changed
> - Change IS_GENERATED to IS_GENERATEDCOLUMN as per spec [PR 1485](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/pgjdbc/pgjdbc/pull/1485)
> - Fix missing metadata columns
column2: and misspelled columns in PgDatabaseMetaData#getTables [PR 1323](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/pgjdbc/pgjdbc/pull/1323)

column1: > ### Added
> - CI tests with Java 11
column2: and Java EA

column1: > - Support temporary replication slots in ReplicationCreateSlotBuilder [PR 1306](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/pgjdbc/pgjdbc/pull/1306)
> - Support PostgreSQL 11
> - Return function (PostgreSQL 11) columns in PgDatabaseMetaData#getFunctionColumns
> - Return information on create replication slot
column2: now the snapshot_name is exported

column1: >   to allow a consistent snapshot in some uses cases. [PR 1335](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/pgjdbc/pgjdbc/pull/1335)
> ### Fixed
> - Fixed async copy performance (1ms per op) in SSL mode [PR 1314](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/pgjdbc/pgjdbc/pull/1314)
> - Return Double.NaN for 'NaN'::numeric [PR 1304](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/pgjdbc/pgjdbc/pull/1304)
> - Performance issue in PgDatabaseMetaData#getTypeInfo with lots of types in DB [PR 1302](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/pgjdbc/pgjdbc/pull/1302)
> - PGCopyInputStream#read should cap values to [0
column3: -1 [PR 1349](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/pgjdbc/pgjdbc/pull/1349)

column1: > - Fixes LocalDateTime handling of BC dates [PR 1388](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/pgjdbc/pgjdbc/pull/1388)
> - Release savepoints in autosave mode to prevent out of shared memory errors at the server side [PR 1409](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/pgjdbc/pgjdbc/pull/1409)
> - Fix execution with big decimal in simple query mode. [PR 1463](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/pgjdbc/pgjdbc/pull/1463)
> - Fix rounding for timestamps truncated to dates before 1970 [PR 1502](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/pgjdbc/pgjdbc/pull/1502)

column1: 5073dependabot-preview[bot]27856297closed2019-06-24T05:39:42Z2019-06-24T08:44:41ZBump xmlunit-core from 2.6.2 to 2.6.3"Bumps [xmlunit-core](https://github.com/xmlunit/xmlunit) from 2.6.2 to 2.6.3.
<details>
<summary>Release notes</summary>
*Sourced from [xmlunit-core's releases](https://github.com/xmlunit/xmlunit/releases).*
> ## XMLUnit 2.6.3
> The release fixes a bug in a corner-case and adds a new `isNumber` placeholder.
> The full list of changes:
> * add a new `${xmlunit.isNumber}` placeholder

>   Issue [#153](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/xmlunit/xmlunit/issues/153) via PR [#154](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/xmlunit/xmlunit/pull/154) by [@​NathanAtClarity](https://github.com/NathanAtClarity).
> * the XPath values of a comparison should not be affected by any `NodeFilter` being in effect.
>   Issue [#156](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/xmlunit/xmlunit/issues/156)
</details>
<details>
<summary>Changelog</summary>
*Sourced from [xmlunit-core's changelog](https://github.com/xmlunit/xmlunit/blob/master/RELEASE_NOTES.md).*
> ## XMLUnit for Java 2.6.3 - /Released 2019-06-21/
> * add a new `${xmlunit.isNumber}` placeholder
>   Issue [#153](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/xmlunit/xmlunit/issues/153) via PR
>   [#154](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/xmlunit/xmlunit/pull/154) by
>   [@​NathanAtClarity](https://github.com/NathanAtClarity).
> * the XPath values of a comparison should not be affected by any
>   `NodeFilter` being in effect.
>   Issue [#156](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/xmlunit/xmlunit/issues/156)
</details>
<details>
<summary>Commits</summary>
- [`b7a9e84`](https://github.com/xmlunit/xmlunit/commit/b7a9e84f167c5e1ef3fb72d72dfbaaa24e8366f3) fix versions for 2.6.3 release
- [`51976d8`](https://github.com/xmlunit/xmlunit/commit/51976d842748fb708f7a2494b87e7c66f0c1cc21) let's try to use an explicit matrix with Linux distros set
- [`f7c0686`](https://github.com/xmlunit/xmlunit/commit/f7c068637ec24cff910d73a752674d0536650e67) added missing [@​since](https://github.com/since) to number placeholder
- [`6706388`](https://github.com/xmlunit/xmlunit/commit/67063887335a3ec354fc5c6e1f48bb4eb1fc27d4) whitespace
- [`8e94e6e`](https://github.com/xmlunit/xmlunit/commit/8e94e6ea18be1554af58106cbec8bba5ae9f2221) XPath shouldn't be affected by NodeFilter
- [`3cf072e`](https://github.com/xmlunit/xmlunit/commit/3cf072e13fd288da3ef5a1a83b86d5be1c05a612) testcase for [#156](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/xmlunit/xmlunit/issues/156)
- [`b051968`](https://github.com/xmlunit/xmlunit/commit/b0519685c0bbab843f63ddcba88861b16037e32b) add a test for https://sourceforge.net/p/xmlunit/discussion/73273/thread/92c9...

- [`55a5142`](https://github.com/xmlunit/xmlunit/commit/55a514223ac20508f3a6460cee821a18d38744d6) record [#153](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/xmlunit/xmlunit/issues/153)/[#154](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/xmlunit/xmlunit/issues/154)
column2: thanks to [@​NathanAtClarity](https://github.com/NathanAtClarity)

column1: - [`aaa7277`](https://github.com/xmlunit/xmlunit/commit/aaa72771ea731a0b63c0ddb7ff7359f04b6c6000) Merge pull request [#154](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/xmlunit/xmlunit/issues/154) from ClaritySoftwareSolutions/add-IsNumber-placeholder
- [`e3e245a`](https://github.com/xmlunit/xmlunit/commit/e3e245aa66092e660e2d0e4394c586fc5c3fab78) Addition of `isNumber` placeholder
- Additional commits viewable in [compare view](https://github.com/xmlunit/xmlunit/compare/v2.6.2...v2.6.3)
</details>

<details>

*Sourced from [junit-jupiter's releases](https://github.com/junit-team/junit5/releases).*

> See [Release Notes](http://junit.org/junit5/docs/5.5.0/release-notes/).

> See [Release Notes](http://junit.org/junit5/docs/5.5.0-RC1/release-notes/).

column1: 5101victorjof40925505closed2019-07-04T02:51:25Z2019-07-11T17:37:54ZFixes RIS' data field"<!-- describe the changes you have made here: what
column2: why

column1: Link issues by using the following pattern: [#333](https://github.com/JabRef/jabref/issues/333) or [koppor#49](https://github.com/koppor/jabref/issues/47).
The title of the PR must not reference an issue
column2: because GitHub does not support autolinking there. -->

column1: This pull resquest fixes issue [#4816](https://github.com/JabRef/jabref/issues/4816).
When importing RIS files Jabref checks for date fields (Y1
column2: PY
column3: DA and Y2) and uses the first one it finds. The problem is that Y2 refers to access date
column4: DA in most cases is a generic date
column5: and PY is the publication year(reliable field)*.

column1: https://github.com/JabRef/jabref/blob/40600b35420e688ee5d5758224717b484ad34f84/src/main/java/org/jabref/logic/importer/fileformat/RisImporter.java#L196-L203
We couldn't find references to Y1('primary date'?). However
column2: as already cited in [#4816](https://github.com/JabRef/jabref/issues/4816)
column3: and by doing some exports we found Y1 to be  PY's synonym
column4: furthermore
column5: when PY received a higher priority than Y1
column6: some tests cases didn't pass as there were a missing month field in .bib.

column1: We established a priority system indicated by the dateTags (lowest index higher priority)
https://github.com/VMichelan/jabref/blob/2f243c16f08f2cfeba6f1ab4651970d90eb55546/src/main/java/org/jabref/logic/importer/fileformat/RisImporter.java#L31
We added 2 test cases for this and changed one of the old ones adding the month field.
*https://web.archive.org/web/20120717122530/http://refman.com/support/direct%20export.zip
** nicely displayed in: https://github.com/aurimasv/translators/wiki/RIS-Tag-Map
- [ ] Change in CHANGELOG.md described
- [x] Tests created for changes
- [x] Manually tested changed features in running JabRef
- [ ] Screenshots added in PR description (for bigger UI changes)

<details>
<summary>Release notes</summary>
*Sourced from [applicationinsights-logging-log4j2's releases](https://github.com/Microsoft/ApplicationInsights-Java/releases).*
> ## Application Insights Java SDK 2.4.0
> This introduces Application Insights Java SDK 2.4.0. This adds all the functionality introduced in 2.4.0-BETA and some additional bug fixes and enhancements.
> ## Important Note: Spring Boot Starter Version
> Previously
column2: the Spring Boot Starter had an independent version number
column3: causing some confusion. Future versions the Spring Boot Starter version will track with the SDK version. There will not be a Spring Boot Starter version 1.2.0
column4: and in it's place version 2.4.0.

column1: > ## Changes introduced in 2.4.0-BETA
> The changes to `WebTelemetryModule` in 2.4.0-BETA were reverted back the state in 2.3.1.
> ## Enhancements
> 1. Added retries to CDSProfileFetcher [#901](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/microsoft/ApplicationInsights-Java/pull/901)
> 2. Added caching of sdk version id
column2: reducing number of file IO operations [#896](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/microsoft/ApplicationInsights-Java/pull/896)

column1: > ## Bug Fixes
> 1. Fix [#907](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/microsoft/ApplicationInsights-Java/issues/907) - Ensures string compare is case insensitive when running a SQL explain on a select statement.
> 2. Fixed ThreadLocal leak [#887](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/microsoft/ApplicationInsights-Java/pull/887)
> 3. Fixed QuickPulse schema version [#904](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/microsoft/ApplicationInsights-Java/pull/904)
> 4. Fix [#919](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/microsoft/ApplicationInsights-Java/issues/919) - Fixed issue when adding duplicate Windows performance counter.
> 5. Misc stability improvements [#932](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/microsoft/ApplicationInsights-Java/pull/932)

column1: > ## Application Insights Java SDK 2.4.0-BETA
> Welcome to Application Insights Java SDK 2.4.0-BETA and SpringBoot Starter 1.2.0-BETA. This version introduces several enhancement and bug fixes.
> ## Removed and Deprecated
> 1. Removed support for multiple apps instrumented with single JVM Agent. Instrumentation will only work for single apps in application server.
> 2. Deprecated class `ApplicationInsightsHttpResponseWrapper.java`
> ### Breaking change

> 1. `WebRequestTelemetry` interface now has another method `setRequestTelemetryContext`. This is needed to propagate context explicitly in asynchronous environments. This change is likely to break clients relying on implementation of this interface in their code.
> ## Enhancements
> 1. Introduced beta support for manual context propagation in Async and Explicit Multithreading scenarios.
> Please refer to this wiki (https://github.com/Microsoft/ApplicationInsights-Java/wiki/Distributed-Tracing-in-Asynchronous-Java-Applications) for instructions.
> 2. [#444](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/Microsoft/ApplicationInsights-Java/issues/444) Introduced support to capture asynchronous request.

> 3. [#749](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/Microsoft/ApplicationInsights-Java/issues/749) Introduce beta supported instrumentation for Postgres SQL jdbc4 driver prepared statements via JVM Agent.
> 4. Introduced experimental API's AIHttpServletListener
column2: HttpServerHandler
column3: ApplicationInsightsServletExtractor and HttpExtractor.

column1: > 5. Introduced `WebTelemetryModule.setRequestTelemetryContext` API.
> 6. [#797](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/Microsoft/ApplicationInsights-Java/issues/797) SDKLogger can now be enabled using system properties.
> ## Bug Fixes
> 1. [#879](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/Microsoft/ApplicationInsights-Java/issues/879) Fixed issue with request/dependency correlation
> 2. Fixed [#826](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/Microsoft/ApplicationInsights-Java/issues/826) Remove duplicate Postgres provider.
> 3. [#881](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/Microsoft/ApplicationInsights-Java/issues/881) Fix SDK version in QuickPulse Telemetry.
> 4. [#883](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/Microsoft/ApplicationInsights-Java/issues/883) Fixed dependency metric collection for QuickPulse/LiveMetrics
> 5. [#852](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/Microsoft/ApplicationInsights-Java/issues/852) Fixed bug in `PreparedStatementVisitor` to instrument all overloads of `setTimestamp`.

> 6. Various stability improvements: [#850](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/Microsoft/ApplicationInsights-Java/issues/850) [#849](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/Microsoft/ApplicationInsights-Java/issues/849) [#842](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/Microsoft/ApplicationInsights-Java/issues/842) [#847](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/Microsoft/ApplicationInsights-Java/issues/847) [#843](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/Microsoft/ApplicationInsights-Java/issues/843) [#887](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/Microsoft/ApplicationInsights-Java/issues/887) [#888](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/Microsoft/ApplicationInsights-Java/issues/888)
> ... (truncated)

> # Version 2.4.0
> - Updated Spring Boot Starter version number to track with the SDK version.
> - Upgrade gradle to 5.3.1
> - Fix [#907](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/microsoft/ApplicationInsights-Java/issues/907) - ensure string compare is case insensitive when running a SQL explain on a select statement.
> - Fixed ThreadLocal leak [#887](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/microsoft/ApplicationInsights-Java/pull/887)
> - Fixed QuickPulse schema version [#904](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/microsoft/ApplicationInsights-Java/pull/904)
> - Added retries to CDSProfileFetcher [#901](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/microsoft/ApplicationInsights-Java/pull/901)
> - Fix [#919](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/microsoft/ApplicationInsights-Java/issues/919) - Fixed issue when adding duplicate Windows performance counter.
> - Added caching of sdk version id
column2: reducing number of file IO operations [#896](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/microsoft/ApplicationInsights-Java/pull/896)

column1: > - Fixed bug with live metrics (QuickPulse) where request/dependency durations were being truncated to the millisecond.
> - Misc stability improvements
> [#932](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/microsoft/ApplicationInsights-Java/pull/932)
> [#941](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/microsoft/ApplicationInsights-Java/pull/941)

> [#948](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/microsoft/ApplicationInsights-Java/pull/948)
> # Version 2.4.0-BETA
> - Removed support for multiple apps instrumented with single JVM Agent. Instrumentation will only work for single apps
>   in application server.
> - Fixed [#749](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/Microsoft/ApplicationInsights-Java/issues/749) introduce support for PostgreSQL jdbc4 prepared statements.
> - Introduced support for Manual Async and Explicit Multithreading correlation.
> - <strike>Introduced `setRequestTelemetryContext` API in `WebTelemetryModule` Interface.</strike>
> - Introduced experimental API's `AIHttpServletListner`
column2: `HttpServerHandler`
column3: `ApplicationInsightsServletExtractor`

> - Fixed [#826](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/Microsoft/ApplicationInsights-Java/issues/826) Remove duplicate provider.
> - Fix incorrect sdk version being sent in Quick Pulse payload.
> - Fix [#882](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/Microsoft/ApplicationInsights-Java/issues/882) Dependency metrics does not show up on
> Livemetrics UX.

5123davidemdot12954316closed2019-07-13T23:59:32Z2019-07-14T10:26:00ZAdd search for citations in LaTeX files (back-end and GUI)Here is a **LaTeX parser tool** that reads each file line by line
column2: parses and analyzes them for detecting different citation formats.

column1: Its user interface consists of a first dialog box that will **ask the user for a directory** to search TEX files. Then
column2: the user could **select specific files**. After that
column3: the tool parses these files and **shows all the bibliographic entries found** in a new dialog box.

column1: ![latex_parser](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12954316/61177635-9ef7bc00-a5da-11e9-9f4d-b3cfc45d96c4.gif)
Related issue: [#5002](https://github.com/JabRef/jabref/issues/5002).

column1: 5148tobiasdiez5037600closed2019-07-22T22:07:10Z2019-08-02T07:20:11ZMove to extended enums for fields and entry types"<!-- describe the changes you have made here: what
column2: why

column1: Link issues by using the following pattern: [#333](https://github.com/JabRef/jabref/issues/333) or [koppor#49](https://github.com/koppor/jabref/issues/47).
The title of the PR must not reference an issue
column2: because GitHub does not support autolinking there. -->

column1: This is a huge refactor PR. I'm sorry for its size
column2: but I couldn't break it down into smaller pieces. The changes are as follows:

column1: - Introduce extended enum `Field` for fields (e.g `StandardField.AUTHOR` instead of the string ""author"") and use this everywhere. Besides the name of the field
column2: some basic and universal properties are stored (e.g. whether it is a numeric field)

column1: - Introduce the class `BibField` which enriches the `Field` by properties that depend on the entry (type) where this field is used. Right now this is only how important the field is (which should in the long term replace the required/optional dichometry.
- Introduce extended enum `EntryType` for entry types (e.g. `StandardEntryType.ARTICLE` instead of the string ""article"") and use this everywhere.
- Introduce the class `BibEntryType` that enriches an `EntryType` by properties that the user can configure (e.g. required fields).
I tried to not change any behavior
column2: except the following things that I noticed while testing:

column1: - All fields are now properly sorted alphabetically (in the subgroups of required/optional fields) when the entry is written to the bib file.
- Some importers used the field `pubstatus` instead of the standard BibTeX field `pubstate`.
- [x] Change in CHANGELOG.md described
- [ ] Tests created for changes
- [ ] Manually tested changed features in running JabRef
- [ ] Screenshots added in PR description (for bigger UI changes)
- [ ] Ensured that [the git commit message is a good one](https://github.com/joelparkerhenderson/git_commit_message)
- [ ] Check documentation status (Issue created for outdated help page at [help.jabref.org](https://github.com/JabRef/help.jabref.org/issues)?)
<!-- describe the changes you have made here:
Link issues by using the following pattern: [#4629 ](https://github.com/JabRef/jabref/issues/4629).
The title of the PR must not reference an issue
column2: because GitHub does not support autolinking there. -->

column1: -  distinguish the user action between menu and button
-  reuse the Acitons class to add enum to the description of user action

column1: 5155davidemdot12954316closed2019-07-30T00:29:03Z2019-08-09T07:05:23Z"Add a ""LaTeX Citations"" tab to the entry editor""This pull request adds a **_LaTeX Citations_ tab to the entry editor**
column2: to search for citations to the active entry in the LaTeX file directory (it can be configured in the _Library properties_ dialog).

column1: The new tab **can be disabled** in the preferences.
## Summary of changes
### An improved back-end
- Optimized parsing performance
- Non-existing nested files are skipped
- Better exception handling
### The new tab
- New tab in the entry editor: _LaTeX Citations_
- This tab could be disabled in the entry editor preferences
- A progress indicator appears while parsing
- Search cancellation if the active entry is changed (background tasks)
- Parsed files are stored when the tool is run for the first time (much better performance)
- The current search path is shown at the bottom
column2: next to a button to change the LaTeX file directory

column1: - Error logging and handling (some of them are shown in the entry editor)
### A custom user interface controller for listing citations
- Citations list view is the same for dialog tool and tab (`CitationsDisplay`)
- Context of citations
column2: instead of the full line (which is shown as a tooltip)

column1: - Changed absolute file path to a relative one
column2: from the search path

column1: - New icons and styles for context
column2: file path and position (line and column) of a citation

column1: ### Miscellaneous
- Updated `EntryEditor` class for injecting dependencies and fixing minor bugs
- Renamed tool: _LaTeX Citations_ instead of _LaTeX references_
## That is how it works
![latexcitations](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12954316/62509787-d68a0a80-b80c-11e9-84f5-f894f965dc9e.gif)
- [x] Change in CHANGELOG.md described
- [x] Manually tested changed features in running JabRef
- [x] Screenshots added in PR description (for bigger UI changes)
- [x] Ensured that [the git commit message is a good one](https://github.com/joelparkerhenderson/git_commit_message)"786332705229
