<details>
<summary>Release notes</summary>
*Sourced from [archunit-junit5-engine's releases](https://github.com/TNG/ArchUnit/releases).*
> ## ArchUnit 0.11.0
> # Enhancements
> ## Core
> * `DescribedPredicate` now offers a more lambda compatible factory method `DescribedPredicate.describe(description
column2: predicate)` (see [#188](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/TNG/ArchUnit/issues/188); thanks a lot to [@​jzheaux](https://github.com/jzheaux))

column1: > * New factory method `DescribedPredicate.allElements(..)` to complement `DescribedPredicate.anyElementThat(..)` (see https://github.com/TNG/ArchUnit/commit/b8890f447c3621cb16cb21e636b2a5397722c9ec)
> * Support for JDK 13 (see [#195](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/TNG/ArchUnit/issues/195); thanks a lot to [@​jqno](https://github.com/jqno))

> * ArchUnits configuration (`archunit.properties`) and ignore patterns (`archunit_ignore_patterns.txt`) are now loaded with the `ContextClassLoader` instead of the `ClassLoader` of the respective class (see https://github.com/TNG/ArchUnit/commit/81c31f6b7ffd9c4836e1f8a0303724eb7f05ce83)
> ## Lang

> * New method `classes().that().belongToAnyOf(..)` to match any class *or inner class* of the passed classes (see [#173](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/TNG/ArchUnit/issues/173); thanks a lot to [@​moboa](https://github.com/moboa))
> * New method `classes().should().haveOnlyPrivateConstructors()` (see [#204](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/TNG/ArchUnit/issues/204); thanks a lot to [@​sullis](https://github.com/sullis))
> * New methods `members().should().{have
column2: notHave}FullName[Not][Matching](https://github.com/TNG/ArchUnit/blob)` (see [#205](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/TNG/ArchUnit/issues/205); thanks a lot to [@​hankem](https://github.com/hankem))

column1: > ## Library
> * New `FreezingArchRule` to wrap any other `ArchRule` and change the behavior (see [#181](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/TNG/ArchUnit/issues/181)):
>   * on the first run record all existing violations
>   * on further runs only fail by unknown violations
>   * also on further runs automatically decrease the stored violation count if existing violations are solved
>   * compare the [user guide](https://www.archunit.org/userguide/html/000_Index.html#_freezing_arch_rules)
> * New `Architectures.onionArchitecture()` API offering a predefined API for Onion or Hexagonal Architectures
column2: compare the [user guide](https://www.archunit.org/userguide/html/000_Index.html#_onion_architecture) (see [#174](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/TNG/ArchUnit/issues/174); thanks a lot to [@​spanierm](https://github.com/spanierm))

column1: > # JUnit
> * The JUnit 5 platform dependency has been upgraded to version 1.5.1
> # Further Acknowledgement
> * Thanks a lot to [@​hankem](https://github.com/hankem) for adjusting Spotbugs to ignore false positives with JDK 9
> * Thanks a lot to [@​hankem](https://github.com/hankem) for fixing incompatibilities of some tests with JDK 12
> * Thanks a lot to [@​vincent-fuchs](https://github.com/vincent-fuchs) for improving ArchUnit's logging
> * Thanks a lot to [@​sullis](https://github.com/sullis) for upgrading dependencies
</details>

column1: 5166dependabot-preview[bot]27856297closed2019-08-02T05:22:19Z2019-08-06T12:39:39ZBump tika-core from 1.21 to 1.22"Bumps [tika-core](https://github.com/apache/tika) from 1.21 to 1.22.
<details>
<summary>Changelog</summary>
*Sourced from [tika-core's changelog](https://github.com/apache/tika/blob/master/CHANGES.txt).*
> Release 2.0.0 - ???
>    BREAKING CHANGES in 2.0.0
>    * Remove deprecated Metadata keys/properties (TIKA-1974).
>    Other changes
> Release 1.22 - ???
>    * NOTE: Known regression: PDFBOX-4587 -- PDF passwords with codepoints
>      between 0xF000 and 0XF0000 will cause an exception.
>    * Add parser for HWP v5 files via SooMyung Lee (soomyung) and
>      JinSup Kim (ddoleye) (TIKA-2909).
>    * Fix order of closing streams to avoid ""Failed to close temporary resource""
>      exception (TIKA-2908).
>    * Improve AutoDetectReader performance by caching encoding
>      detector (TIKA-1568).
>    * Prevent RTFParser from outputting illegal tag combinations (TIKA-2889).
>    * Fix RereadableInputStream to release all resources (TIKA-2903).
>    * Implement custom language identifier in the tika-eval module based on
>      OpenNLP's language detector; add 18 languages and add common words
>      lists for all 121 languages (TIKA-2790).
>    * Fix NPE in MimeTypesReader.releaseParser() via Eamonn Saunders (TIKA-2896).
>    * Fix RTFParser to extract more content (TIKA-2883).
>    * Add clientSubmitTime to the metadata extracted from PST files (TIKA-2898).
>    * Improve StreamingZipContainerDetector for xltx
column2: xltm and

column1: >      several other file formats (TIKA-2886).
>    * Add optional AUTO mode to OCR'ing of PDFs.  If tesseract is installed
>      and on the path
column2: and this option is selected programmatically

column1: >      or via TikaConfig()
column2: the PDFParser will use heuristics to decide

column1: >      whether or not to run OCR per page on PDFs. (TIKA-2749)
>    * The ZipContainerDetector's default behavior was changed to run
>      streaming detection up to its markLimit.  Users can get the
>      legacy behavior (spool-to-file/rely-on-underlying-file-in-TikaInputStream)
>      by setting markLimit=-1. The POIFSContainerDetector requires an underlying file;
>      it will try to spool the file to disk; if the file's length is > markLimit
> ... (truncated)
</details>

column1: 5167davidemdot12954316closed2019-08-02T13:29:51Z2019-08-02T13:30:41ZLaTeX integration latest changes"Patch for solving some issues commented in: https://github.com/JabRef/jabref/pull/5155#issuecomment-517240431
- [x] Update 'LaTeX Citations' tab for displaying the current search path and add a button to set the LaTeX file directory.
- [x] Update 'LaTeX Citations' tab for caching previous result of parsing files.
- [x] Update LaTeX parser for testing the existence of any file before reading it.
- [x] Update for improving handling exceptions."00996276

5168davidemdot12954316closed2019-08-02T16:55:13Z2019-08-05T18:02:42ZFix fail on testPerformExportForSingleEntry from DocBook5ExporterTest"Fix a bug that appeared on `DocBook5ExporterTest` (`testPerformExportForSingleEntry`) since the last commit in the master branch (https://github.com/JabRef/jabref/commit/4b39b78e4afcd6c36b385f5c46f1d9a4eac2e29b).
The point is that the `<biblioset>` node is not contained in the export file. Also
column2: I have used `normalizeWhitespace()` and `ignoreComments()` methods.

column1: I have added the [WIP] mark because I still want to check if there is any trouble with the exporter. Any help about this?"302322
5170davidemdot12954316closed2019-08-04T20:08:31Z2019-08-04T20:10:22ZAdd latest changes to latexintegration branch"- Change CitationViewModel to CitationsDisplay.
- Improve styles and icons.
- Remove unused code.

<details>
<summary>Release notes</summary>
*Sourced from [applicationinsights-core's releases](https://github.com/Microsoft/ApplicationInsights-Java/releases).*
> ## Application Insights Java SDK 2.4.1
> This introduces Application Insights Java SDK 2.4.1. This release includes a critical bug fix.
> # Bug Fixes
> * Fixed [#910](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/microsoft/ApplicationInsights-Java/issues/910). In some rare cases
column2: correlation id serialization would produce an id with a smaller than the expected length. This caused validation to fail and an exception to be thrown.

column1: > # Miscellaneous
> * Spring boot dependencies were upgraded to version 1.5.21
</details>

> - Upgraded spring boot dependencies in spring-boot-starter from 1.5.9 to 1.5.21.
</details>

column1: 5234koppor1366654closed2019-08-25T15:47:37Z2019-08-27T07:15:22ZRemove testing on OracleJDK - we stick to OpenJDK onlyWhen getting JabRef close to a release
column2: waiting 30 minutes
column3: until all TravisCI tests pass is not amusing. OpenJDK is open source
column4: OracleJDK is some closed source distribution. I would vote for testing JabRef with OpenJDK only. In case OracleJDK makes something worse
column5: user will complain then. I think
column6: however
column7: it is very unlikely

5237dependabot-preview[bot]27856297closed2019-08-26T07:42:41Z2019-08-26T09:02:49ZBump archunit-junit5-api from 0.10.2 to 0.11.0Bumps [archunit-junit5-api](https://github.com/TNG/ArchUnit) from 0.10.2 to 0.11.0.
<details>
<summary>Release notes</summary>
*Sourced from [archunit-junit5-api's releases](https://github.com/TNG/ArchUnit/releases).*
> ## ArchUnit 0.11.0
> # Enhancements
> ## Core
> * `DescribedPredicate` now offers a more lambda compatible factory method `DescribedPredicate.describe(description
column2: predicate)` (see [#188](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/TNG/ArchUnit/issues/188); thanks a lot to [@​jzheaux](https://github.com/jzheaux))

column1: > * New factory method `DescribedPredicate.allElements(..)` to complement `DescribedPredicate.anyElementThat(..)` (see https://github.com/TNG/ArchUnit/commit/b8890f447c3621cb16cb21e636b2a5397722c9ec)
> * Support for JDK 13 (see [#195](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/TNG/ArchUnit/issues/195); thanks a lot to [@​jqno](https://github.com/jqno))

> * ArchUnits configuration (`archunit.properties`) and ignore patterns (`archunit_ignore_patterns.txt`) are now loaded with the `ContextClassLoader` instead of the `ClassLoader` of the respective class (see https://github.com/TNG/ArchUnit/commit/81c31f6b7ffd9c4836e1f8a0303724eb7f05ce83)
> ## Lang

> * New method `classes().that().belongToAnyOf(..)` to match any class *or inner class* of the passed classes (see [#173](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/TNG/ArchUnit/issues/173); thanks a lot to [@​moboa](https://github.com/moboa))
> * New method `classes().should().haveOnlyPrivateConstructors()` (see [#204](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/TNG/ArchUnit/issues/204); thanks a lot to [@​sullis](https://github.com/sullis))
> * New methods `members().should().{have
column2: notHave}FullName[Not][Matching](https://github.com/TNG/ArchUnit/blob)` (see [#205](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/TNG/ArchUnit/issues/205); thanks a lot to [@​hankem](https://github.com/hankem))

column1: > ## Library
> * New `FreezingArchRule` to wrap any other `ArchRule` and change the behavior (see [#181](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/TNG/ArchUnit/issues/181)):
>   * on the first run record all existing violations
>   * on further runs only fail by unknown violations
>   * also on further runs automatically decrease the stored violation count if existing violations are solved
>   * compare the [user guide](https://www.archunit.org/userguide/html/000_Index.html#_freezing_arch_rules)
> * New `Architectures.onionArchitecture()` API offering a predefined API for Onion or Hexagonal Architectures
column2: compare the [user guide](https://www.archunit.org/userguide/html/000_Index.html#_onion_architecture) (see [#174](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/TNG/ArchUnit/issues/174); thanks a lot to [@​spanierm](https://github.com/spanierm))

column1: > # JUnit
> * The JUnit 5 platform dependency has been upgraded to version 1.5.1
> # Further Acknowledgement
> * Thanks a lot to [@​hankem](https://github.com/hankem) for adjusting Spotbugs to ignore false positives with JDK 9
> * Thanks a lot to [@​hankem](https://github.com/hankem) for fixing incompatibilities of some tests with JDK 12
> * Thanks a lot to [@​vincent-fuchs](https://github.com/vincent-fuchs) for improving ArchUnit's logging
> * Thanks a lot to [@​sullis](https://github.com/sullis) for upgrading dependencies
</details>

column1: 5240dependabot-preview[bot]27856297closed2019-08-26T07:45:53Z2019-08-26T09:28:45ZBump error_prone_core from 2.3.2 to 2.3.3"Bumps [error_prone_core](https://github.com/google/error-prone) from 2.3.2 to 2.3.3.
<details>
<summary>Release notes</summary>
*Sourced from [error_prone_core's releases](https://github.com/google/error-prone/releases).*
> ## Error Prone 2.3.3
> ## New checks:
> * [`AssignmentToMock`](http://errorprone.info/bugpattern/AssignmentToMock): Fields annotated with [@​Mock](https://github.com/Mock) should not be manually assigned to.
> * [`AutoValueImmutableFields`](http://errorprone.info/bugpattern/AutoValueImmutableFields): AutoValue recommends using immutable collections

> * [`CompareToZero`](http://errorprone.info/bugpattern/CompareToZero): The result of #compareTo or #compare should only be compared to 0. It is an implementation detail whether a given type returns strictly the values {-1
column3: +1} or others.

column1: > * [`DeduplicateConstants`](http://errorprone.info/bugpattern/DeduplicateConstants): This expression was previously declared as a constant; consider replacing this occurrence.
> * [`DiscardedPostfixExpression`](http://errorprone.info/bugpattern/DiscardedPostfixExpression): The result of this unary operation on a lambda parameter is discarded
> * [`DuplicateMapKeys`](http://errorprone.info/bugpattern/DuplicateMapKeys): Map#ofEntries will throw an IllegalArgumentException if there are any duplicate keys
> * [`EscapedEntity`](http://errorprone.info/bugpattern/EscapedEntity): HTML entities in @code/[@​literal](https://github.com/literal) tags will appear literally in the rendered javadoc.
> * [`InheritDoc`](http://errorprone.info/bugpattern/InheritDoc): Invalid use of [@​inheritDoc](https://github.com/inheritDoc).

> * [`InterfaceWithOnlyStatics`](http://errorprone.info/bugpattern/InterfaceWithOnlyStatics): This interface only contains static fields and methods; consider making it a final class instead to prevent subclassing.
> * [`InvalidBlockTag`](http://errorprone.info/bugpattern/InvalidBlockTag): This tag is invalid.
> * [`InvalidInlineTag`](http://errorprone.info/bugpattern/InvalidInlineTag): This tag is invalid.
> * [`MissingSummary`](http://errorprone.info/bugpattern/MissingSummary): A summary line is required on public/protected Javadocs.
> * [`MixedDescriptors`](http://errorprone.info/bugpattern/MixedDescriptors): The field number passed into #getFieldByNumber belongs to a different proto to the Descriptor.

> * [`MixedMutabilityReturnType`](http://errorprone.info/bugpattern/MixedMutabilityReturnType): This method returns both mutable and immutable collections or maps from different paths. This may be confusing for users of the method.
> * [`MockitoInternalUsage`](http://errorprone.info/bugpattern/MockitoInternalUsage): org.mockito.internal.* is a private API and should not be used by clients
> * [`OptionalMapToOptional`](http://errorprone.info/bugpattern/OptionalMapToOptional): Mapping to another Optional will yield a nested Optional. Did you mean flatMap?

> * [`OutlineNone`](http://errorprone.info/bugpattern/OutlineNone): Setting CSS outline style to none or 0 (while not otherwise providing visual focus indicators) is inaccessible for users navigating a web page without a mouse.
> * [`PreconditionsCheckNotNullRepeated`](http://errorprone.info/bugpattern/PreconditionsCheckNotNullRepeated): Including the first argument of checkNotNull in the failure message is not useful
column2: as it will always be `null`.

column1: > * [`RedundantOverride`](http://errorprone.info/bugpattern/RedundantOverride): This override is redundant
column2: and can be removed.

column1: > * [`RefersToDaggerCodegen`](http://errorprone.info/bugpattern/RefersToDaggerCodegen): Don't refer to Dagger's internal or generated code
> * [`RxReturnValueIgnored`](http://errorprone.info/bugpattern/RxReturnValueIgnored): Returned Rx objects must be checked. Ignoring a returned Rx value means it is never scheduled for execution
> * [`TreeToString`](http://errorprone.info/bugpattern/TreeToString): Tree#toString shouldn't be used for Trees deriving from the code being compiled
column2: as it discards whitespace and comments.

column1: > * [`TypeEquals`](http://errorprone.info/bugpattern/TypeEquals): com.sun.tools.javac.code.Type doesn't override Object.equals and instances are not interned by javac
column2: so testing types for equality should be done with Types#isSameType instead

column1: > * [`UnescapedEntity`](http://errorprone.info/bugpattern/UnescapedEntity): Javadoc is interpreted as HTML
column2: so HTML entities such as &
column4: > must be escaped.

column1: > * [`UnusedMethod`](http://errorprone.info/bugpattern/UnusedMethod): Unused.
> * [`UnusedNestedClass`](http://errorprone.info/bugpattern/UnusedNestedClass): This nested class is unused
column2: and can be removed.

column1: > * [`UnusedVariable`](http://errorprone.info/bugpattern/UnusedVariable): Unused.
> ## New date and time related checks:
> * [`JavaDurationGetSecondsGetNano`](http://errorprone.info/bugpattern/JavaDurationGetSecondsGetNano): duration.getNano() only accesses the underlying nanosecond adjustment from the whole second.
> * [`JavaDurationWithNanos`](http://errorprone.info/bugpattern/JavaDurationWithNanos): Use of java.time.Duration.withNanos(int) is not allowed.
> * [`JavaDurationWithSeconds`](http://errorprone.info/bugpattern/JavaDurationWithSeconds): Use of java.time.Duration.withSeconds(long) is not allowed.
> * [`JavaInstantGetSecondsGetNano`](http://errorprone.info/bugpattern/JavaInstantGetSecondsGetNano): instant.getNano() only accesses the underlying nanosecond adjustment from the whole second.
> * [`JavaTimeDefaultTimeZone`](http://errorprone.info/bugpattern/JavaTimeDefaultTimeZone): java.time APIs that silently use the default system time-zone are not allowed.
> * [`JodaDurationConstructor`](http://errorprone.info/bugpattern/JodaDurationConstructor): Use of new Duration(long) is not allowed. Please use Duration.millis(long) instead.
> * [`JodaDurationWithMillis`](http://errorprone.info/bugpattern/JodaDurationWithMillis): Use of duration.withMillis(long) is not allowed. Please use Duration.millis(long) instead.
> * [`JodaInstantWithMillis`](http://errorprone.info/bugpattern/JodaInstantWithMillis): Use of instant.withMillis(long) is not allowed. Please use new Instant(long) instead.
> * [`JodaNewPeriod`](http://errorprone.info/bugpattern/JodaNewPeriod): This may have surprising semantics
column2: e.g. new Period(LocalDate.parse(""1970-01-01"")
column3: LocalDate.parse(""1970-02-02"")).getDays() == 1
column4: not 32.

column1: > * [`JodaPlusMinusLong`](http://errorprone.info/bugpattern/JodaPlusMinusLong): Use of JodaTime's type.plus(long) or type.minus(long) is not allowed (where <type> = {Duration
column2: Instant
column3: DateTime
column4: DateMidnight}). Please use  type.plus(Duration.millis(long)) or type.minus(Duration.millis(long)) instead.

column1: > * [`JodaTimeConverterManager`](http://errorprone.info/bugpattern/JodaTimeConverterManager): Joda-Time's ConverterManager makes the semantics of DateTime/Instant/etc construction subject to global static state. If you need to define your own converters
column2: use a helper.

column1: > * [`JodaToSelf`](http://errorprone.info/bugpattern/JodaToSelf): Use of Joda-Time's DateTime.toDateTime()
column2: Duration.toDuration()
column3: Instant.toInstant()
column4: Interval.toInterval()
column5: and Period.toPeriod() are not allowed.

column1: > * [`JodaWithDurationAddedLong`](http://errorprone.info/bugpattern/JodaWithDurationAddedLong): Use of JodaTime's type.withDurationAdded(long
column2: int) (where <type> = {Duration
column3: Instant
column4: DateTime}). Please use type.withDurationAdded(Duration.millis(long)
column5: int) instead.

column1: > * [`TemporalAccessorGetChronoField`](http://errorprone.info/bugpattern/TemporalAccessorGetChronoField): TemporalAccessor.get() only works for certain values of ChronoField.

> * [`TimeUnitConversionChecker`](http://errorprone.info/bugpattern/TimeUnitConversionChecker): This TimeUnit conversion looks buggy: converting from a smaller unit to a larger unit (and passing a constant)
column2: converting to/from the same TimeUnit
column3: or converting TimeUnits where the result is statically known to be 0 or 1 are all buggy patterns.

column1: > * [`DurationFrom`](http://errorprone.info/bugpattern/DurationFrom): Duration.from(Duration) returns itself; from(Period) throws a runtime exception.
> * [`DurationGetTemporalUnit`](http://errorprone.info/bugpattern/DurationGetTemporalUnit): Duration.get() only works with SECONDS or NANOS.
> ... (truncated)
</details>
<details>
<summary>Commits</summary>

- [`60e2caf`](https://github.com/google/error-prone/commit/60e2caff0e86c468fa3647a22f0e10fc2cb02012) Undo accidental version downgrade in cbe145af6e705512e6ac765e48860844ef8c00dd.

- [`1f2fed9`](https://github.com/google/error-prone/commit/1f2fed928c87a548588278fe4333688e40b31ffe) Remove [@​BugPattern](https://github.com/BugPattern).category
- [`530c14e`](https://github.com/google/error-prone/commit/530c14eff6a74c6ddcd9043e1adbd26fd5f79948) Open-source tests for annotated APIs in ApiDiffChecker.
- [`a115dc3`](https://github.com/google/error-prone/commit/a115dc38ba176ff98dab737d8fad9585be384122) Make UnusedVariable catch (some) unused assignments

column1: - [`01d4242`](https://github.com/google/error-prone/commit/01d4242f653bd0de7bfe2b687aa5b7e95b97bad8) minor additions to java.io
- [`42911a2`](https://github.com/google/error-prone/commit/42911a257ef7f811855effede17a546eb253c809) Remove uses of [@​BugPattern](https://github.com/BugPattern).category

column1: 5241dependabot-preview[bot]27856297closed2019-08-26T07:46:20Z2019-08-26T09:01:42ZBump byte-buddy-parent from 1.9.13 to 1.10.1"Bumps [byte-buddy-parent](https://github.com/raphw/byte-buddy) from 1.9.13 to 1.10.1.
<details>
<summary>Release notes</summary>
*Sourced from [byte-buddy-parent's releases](https://github.com/raphw/byte-buddy/releases).*
> ## Byte Buddy 1.10.1
> - Extend `VirtualMachine` API emulation.
> - Reopen socket for POSIX-HotSpot connections after each command being sent to avoid broken pipe errors.
> - Only use JNA API that is available in JNA versions 4 and 5 for better compatibility.
> - Include correct license information in artifacts.
> - Add injection API based on `jdk.internal.misc.Unsafe` to support agents on platforms that do not include *jdk.unsupported*.
> - Add `AgentBuilder.InjectionStrategy` to allow usage of internal injection API.
> - Open package in `AgentBuilder` if from and to edges are added.
> ## Byte Buddy 1.10.0
> - Add API for loading native agents from Byte Buddy agent.
> - Extend `VirtualMachine` API to include other methods.
> - Fix error handling in `VirtualMachine` API.
> - Fix temporary folder resolution for `VirtualMachine` API.
> - Add API for `MemberAttributeExtension`.
> - Rework of `AnnotationDescription` API to emulate JVM error handling for incorrect or inconsistent values.
> - Add generic type-aware `Assigner`.
> - Fix method handle-based injector for Java 14.
> ## Byte Buddy 1.9.16
> - Add support for attach emulation on Solaris.
> - Fix JNA signatures for attach emulation on POSIX.
> - Add standard call conventions for Windows JNA calls.
> ## Byte Buddy 1.9.15
> - Add emulated attach mechanism for HotSpot on Windows and for OpenJ9/J9 on POSIX and Windows (if JNA is present).
> - Reimplement POSIX attach mechanism for HotSpot to use JNA (if present).
> ## Byte Buddy 1.9.14
> - Add Java 14 compatibility.
> - Refactor emulated attach mechanism and use JNA in order to prepare supporting other mechanisms in the future.
> - Reinterrupt threads if interruption exceptions are catched in threads not owned by Byte Buddy.
> - Refactor class file dumping.
> - Publish Gradle plugin to Gradle plugin repository.
</details>
<details>
<summary>Changelog</summary>
*Sourced from [byte-buddy-parent's changelog](https://github.com/raphw/byte-buddy/blob/master/release-notes.md).*
> ### 9. August 2019: version 1.10.1
> - Extend `VirtualMachine` API emulation.
> - Reopen socket for POSIX-HotSpot connections after each command being sent to avoid broken pipe errors.
> - Only use JNA API that is available in JNA versions 4 and 5 for better compatibility.
> - Include correct license information in artifacts.
> - Add injection API based on `jdk.internal.misc.Unsafe` to support agents on platforms that do not include *jdk.unsupported*.
> - Add `AgentBuilder.InjectionStrategy` to allow usage of internal injection API.
> - Open package in `AgentBuilder` if from and to edges are added.
> ### 3. August 2019: version 1.10.0
> - Add API for loading native agents from Byte Buddy agent.
> - Extend `VirtualMachine` API to include other methods.
> - Fix error handling in `VirtualMachine` API.
> - Fix temporary folder resolution for `VirtualMachine` API.
> - Add API for `MemberAttributeExtension`.
> - Rework of `AnnotationDescription` API to emulate JVM error handling for incorrect or inconsistent values.
> - Add generic type-aware `Assigner`.
> - Fix method handle-based injector for Java 14.
> - Add support for attach emulation on Solaris.
> - Fix JNA signatures for attach emulation on POSIX.
> - Add standard call conventions for Windows JNA calls.
> - Add emulated attach mechanism for HotSpot on Windows and for OpenJ9/J9 on POSIX and Windows (if JNA is present).
> - Reimplement POSIX attach mechanism for HotSpot to use JNA (if present).
> - Add Java 14 compatibility.
> - Refactor emulated attach mechanism and use JNA in order to prepare supporting other mechanisms in the future.
> - Reinterrupt threads if interruption exceptions are catched in threads not owned by Byte Buddy.
> - Refactor class file dumping.
> - Publish Gradle plugin to Gradle plugin repository.
</details>
<details>
<summary>Commits</summary>
- [`c24319a`](https://github.com/raphw/byte-buddy/commit/c24319ae581137e9a55071b22e38b1aa6aa3f51d) [maven-release-plugin] prepare release byte-buddy-1.10.1
- [`c64bc81`](https://github.com/raphw/byte-buddy/commit/c64bc8174fbe533a12fdf60b8e4dacdd3c355cdc) Add additional tests.
- [`b609711`](https://github.com/raphw/byte-buddy/commit/b60971156403ed8fba6124b8e424f0749917594a) Remove appendix from license file.
- [`851f299`](https://github.com/raphw/byte-buddy/commit/851f29971fdf4cb0d95cc2f76a2fa48d4e4c4b65) Remove unneccessary read.
- [`1cea33a`](https://github.com/raphw/byte-buddy/commit/1cea33a4e4f48a37889e570dbb640fc20fe5a4cf) Clean up API.
- [`8b0049d`](https://github.com/raphw/byte-buddy/commit/8b0049d8297260e909410f63e0712ca679d2a655) Create new connection for every HotSpot command as it is required.
- [`7166326`](https://github.com/raphw/byte-buddy/commit/71663261ea2d104fefd1daabb4f9cbf1f8586808) Use null constants.
- [`8dc808e`](https://github.com/raphw/byte-buddy/commit/8dc808e59a5bec1da8c57b5692ae533c5b245f3b) Factor out duplicated code.
- [`6adfcb0`](https://github.com/raphw/byte-buddy/commit/6adfcb0e211155a7d233474d23db4935747808e8) Fix build for Java 6.
- [`5ead6b2`](https://github.com/raphw/byte-buddy/commit/5ead6b283884ca781d853fd69e02d359679cde1e) Extend virtual machine API. Do not build Android test on Java 6.

column1: 1. Add the following compiler arguments for the `JabRef.main` module:

--patch-module test=fastparse_2.12-1.0.0.jar --patch-module test2=fastparse-utils_2.12-1.0.0.jar --patch-module test3=sourcecode_2.12-0.1.4.jar --add-exports javafx.controls/com.sun.javafx.scene.control=org.jabref --add-exports org.controlsfx.controls/impl.org.controlsfx.skin=org.jabref --add-exports javafx.graphics/com.sun.javafx.scene=org.controlsfx.controls --add-exports javafx.graphics/com.sun.javafx.scene.traversal=org.controlsfx.controls --add-exports javafx.graphics/com.sun.javafx.css=org.controlsfx.controls --add-exports javafx.controls/com.sun.javafx.scene.control.behavior=org.controlsfx.controls --add-exports javafx.controls/com.sun.javafx.scene.control=org.controlsfx.controls --add-exports javafx.controls/com.sun.javafx.scene.control.inputmap=org.controlsfx.controls --add-exports javafx.base/com.sun.javafx.event=org.controlsfx.controls --add-exports javafx.base/com.sun.javafx.collections=org.controlsfx.controls --add-exports javafx.base/com.sun.javafx.runtime=org.controlsfx.controls --add-exports javafx.web/com.sun.webkit=org.controlsfx.controls --add-exports javafx.graphics/com.sun.javafx.css=org.controlsfx.controls --patch-module org.jabref=build\resources\main
2. Switch to Java 11 jdk
3. Select ""Intellj IDEA"" in Settings > Build Tools > Gradle > ""Build and run using"" and ""Run tests using""
4. Use the provided run configuration.
Only problem is that I had to disable the error prone plugin. However
column2: I would say that it is more important to have a simple compilation than this code checker.

5264Siedlerchr320228closed2019-09-01T16:04:55Z2019-09-04T18:03:14Z[WIP] Get JabRef running in eclipseI finally figured out how to make JabRef working with java 11 in eclipse.
Requires eclipse 2019-06 minimum
uncomment java version checker
column2: does not work inside eclipse

column1: TODO: Write up or generate the classpath entries with add opens as well
TODO: mark jmh as test resource folder
1. Run gradlew eclipse
2. Go to build path  -> Libraries
3.  Move all test related libs to classpath
4. Move jmh to classpath as well
5. Go to Source -> Mark src/jmh as test folder
6. Go to Module dependencies
6.1. Select `org.controlsfx.controls` in the list
6.2. Add export and opens entry  for `impl.org.controlsfx.autocompletion`
column2: `impl.org.controlsfx.skin` and `org.controlsfx.control.textfield`  to `org.jabref`

column1: 6.3. Select `javafx.controls` add epxorts and opens entry for `com.sun.javafx.scene.control`  to `org.jabref`
JPMS options should look like this:

--add-exports org.controlsfx.controls/impl.org.controlsfx.autocompletion=org.jabref --add-exports org.controlsfx.controls/impl.org.controlsfx.skin=org.jabref --add-exports org.controlsfx.controls/org.controlsfx.control.textfield=org.jabref --add-opens org.controlsfx.controls/impl.org.controlsfx.autocompletion=org.jabref --add-opens org.controlsfx.controls/impl.org.controlsfx.skin=org.jabref --add-opens org.controlsfx.controls/org.controlsfx.control.textfield=org.jabref --add-exports javafx.controls/com.sun.javafx.scene.control=org.jabref --add-opens javafx.controls/com.sun.javafx.scene.control=org.jabref
7. Create a run/debug configuration for main class `org.jabref.JabRefLauncher`
8. In the arguments tab enter this for VM arguments.

-Djabref.theme.css --patch-module test=fastparse_2.12-1.0.0.jar --patch-module test2=fastparse-utils_2.12-1.0.0.jar --patch-module test3=sourcecode_2.12-0.1.4.jar --patch-module org.jabref=build\resources\main --add-exports javafx.controls/com.sun.javafx.scene.control=org.jabref --add-exports org.controlsfx.controls/impl.org.controlsfx.skin=org.jabref --add-opens javafx.controls/javafx.scene.control=org.jabref --add-opens org.controlsfx.controls/org.controlsfx.control.textfield=org.jabref --add-exports javafx.graphics/com.sun.javafx.scene=org.controlsfx.controls --add-exports javafx.graphics/com.sun.javafx.scene.traversal=org.controlsfx.controls --add-exports javafx.graphics/com.sun.javafx.css=org.controlsfx.controls --add-exports javafx.controls/com.sun.javafx.scene.control.behavior=org.controlsfx.controls --add-exports javafx.controls/com.sun.javafx.scene.control=org.controlsfx.controls --add-exports javafx.controls/com.sun.javafx.scene.control.inputmap=org.controlsfx.controls --add-exports javafx.base/com.sun.javafx.event=org.controlsfx.controls --add-exports javafx.base/com.sun.javafx.collections=org.controlsfx.controls --add-exports javafx.base/com.sun.javafx.runtime=org.controlsfx.controls --add-exports javafx.web/com.sun.webkit=org.controlsfx.controls --add-exports javafx.graphics/com.sun.javafx.css=org.controlsfx.controls --add-opens javafx.controls/javafx.scene.control.skin=org.controlsfx.controls --add-opens javafx.graphics/javafx.scene=org.controlsfx.controls""

<details>

*Sourced from [guava's releases](https://github.com/google/guava/releases).*
> ### Maven
> ```xml
> <dependency>
>   <groupId>com.google.guava</groupId>
>   <artifactId>guava</artifactId>
>   <version>28.1-jre</version>

column2: for Android: -->

column1: >   <version>28.1-android</version>
> </dependency>
> ### Javadoc
> - [28.1-jre](http://google.github.io/guava/releases/28.1-jre/api/docs/)
> - [28.1-android](http://google.github.io/guava/releases/28.1-android/api/docs/)
> ### JDiff
> - [28.1-jre vs. 28.0-jre](http://google.github.io/guava/releases/28.1-jre/api/diffs/)
> - [28.1-android vs. 28.0-android](http://google.github.io/guava/releases/28.1-android/api/diffs/)
> - [28.1-android vs. 28.1-jre](http://google.github.io/guava/releases/28.1-android/api/androiddiffs/)
> ### Changelog
> - `collect`: Added `RangeMap.merge`
column2: analogous to `Map.merge`. (687252d35)

column1: > - `collect`: Fixed a bug in `ImmutableSet.Builder` that could lead to infinite loops when building multiple sets from the same builder. (0007cb257)
> - `io`: Fixed an issue where the `InputStream` returned by `BaseEncoding.decodingStream(Reader)` could fail to throw `DecodingException` while decoding an invalid string. (ddd4a49fb)
> - `net`: Added `MediaType` for ""image/heif"" and ""image/jp2"" (508696a4c)
> - `net`: Added `Upgrade-Insecure-Requests` header to `HttpHeaders`. (6a8b716af)
> - `concurrent`: Fixed potential memory leak in `Futures.whenAllSucceed/whenAllComplete` (494834bd4)
</details>

<summary>Commits</summary>
- See full diff in [compare view](https://github.com/google/guava/commits)

column1: 5273dependabot-preview[bot]27856297closed2019-09-02T07:39:52Z2019-09-02T08:16:08ZBump richtextfx from 0.10.1 to 0.10.2"Bumps [richtextfx](https://github.com/FXMisc/RichTextFX) from 0.10.1 to 0.10.2.
<details>
<summary>Release notes</summary>
*Sourced from [richtextfx's releases](https://github.com/FXMisc/RichTextFX/releases).*
> This release features multi-release JAR files that are compatible with Java 8 and UP without the need for `add-exports` or `add-opens` JVM arguments.
> **Note** that you still need to include the JAR files on the classpath irrespective of the Java version being used.
> See the [Changelog](https://github.com/FXMisc/RichTextFX/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#v0102-2019-08-29)
> Notable enhancement is the addition of a line highlighter API:
> ```java
> setLineHighlighterFill( Paint highlight )
> setLineHighlighterOn( boolean show )
> isLineHighlighterOn()
> The highlighter can be styled via CSS using selectors from Path
column2: Shape
column3: and Node. For example:

column1: > ```css
> .styled-text-area .line-highlighter { -fx-fill: lime; }
> .line-highlighter { -fx-highlight-fill: lime; }
> Any added custom Selections can now also be styled via CSS using the selection's name.
</details>
<details>
<summary>Changelog</summary>
*Sourced from [richtextfx's changelog](https://github.com/FXMisc/RichTextFX/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md).*
> ## [v0.10.2](https://github.com/FXMisc/RichTextFX/tree/v0.10.2) (2019-08-29)
> [Full Changelog](https://github.com/FXMisc/RichTextFX/compare/v0.10.1...v0.10.2)
> **Implemented enhancements:**
> - Added line highlighter enhancement [\#845](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/FXMisc/RichTextFX/issues/845)
> - Enhanced CodeArea selection to include underscore [\#837](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/FXMisc/RichTextFX/issues/837)
> - Added auto-indent on enter to JavaKeywordsDemo  [\#846](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/FXMisc/RichTextFX/issues/846)

column1: 5276dawidowoc47257983closed2019-09-02T16:31:23Z2019-09-08T08:39:50ZAdd shorten DOI field formatter"<!-- describe the changes you have made here: what
column2: why

column1: Link issues by using the following pattern: [#333](https://github.com/JabRef/jabref/issues/333) or [koppor#49](https://github.com/koppor/jabref/issues/47).
The title of the PR must not reference an issue
column2: because GitHub does not support autolinking there. -->

column1: ### What this PR adds?
This PR is related to [koppor#343](https://github.com/koppor/jabref/issues/343).

I added a field formatter called **Shorten DOI** formatter which shortens DOI using http://shortdoi.org service. You run the formatter from _Cleanup entries dialog_ by adding it to _Run field formatter_ list.
It looks to work fine. It enables one way conversion from DOI to short DOI.
### Implementation details:
I assumed that short DOI is still a legal DOI. That's why I adjusted the DOI class to work with short DOIs.
### Feedback wanted
I I'd like to ask for your feedback about the code at this stage.
### Next step
- Add a more accessible UI - a toggle button next to the DOI field _shortened/long version_ (This was suggested by @koppor)
This will require adding opposite conversion (from short DOI to DOI). As http://shortdoi.org servcie doesn't offer such a feature I see two approaches:
1. Store the original DOI during the conversion for further back conversion.
**Drawback:** You may not convert from short DOI to DOI if you haven't done the opposite conversion for at least one time.
2. Try to obtain DOI from short DOI using https://doi.org service as it is possible by catching the HTTP redirection
I find the 1st approach fine. The 2th approach is not really good as we are not using any public API and this can stop working in the future.
What do you think folks? :)
### Important

If you would like to checkout this branch and test locally please use [shortdoi-workaround](https://github.com/dawidowoc/jabref/tree/shortdoi-workaround) branch which uses workaround by @r0light for issue [#5245](https://github.com/JabRef/jabref/issues/5245). On master branch there is an issue with accessing _General tab_ in bibentry editor.

1. Use sockets instead of pipes (cause jpipe is a dll/lib in the LO dir and cannot be found at class loading
2.  Pass an URL ClassLoader as parent to the Bootstrap method.

column1: Improve drag & drop by providing the user with visual feedback what the target of the action is and suggests what the action is. Fixes https://github.com/JabRef/jabref/issues/5017.
Open files by dropping them on the tab header:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5037600/64727103-61c78180-d4d8-11e9-9fab-433c933ba4a2.png)
Linking a file to an entry by dropping it onto the entry:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5037600/64727158-80c61380-d4d8-11e9-9386-e2a0e4ed13e4.png)
Create new entry based on file by dropping it between entries (or at the beginning/end of the list):
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5037600/64727188-989d9780-d4d8-11e9-912b-61bb21367e19.png)

column1: Use Github actions and jpackager for deployment. Rip circleci ❤️ . Rip install4j❤️
The following files are created and deployed to builds.jabref.org (and as github artifacts):
- for Windows: JabRef-5.0.0.msi (installer) and JabRef-portable-windows.zip (unzip & run)
- for Linux: jabRef-5.0.0-1_amd64.deb & jabRef-5.0.0-1_x64.rpm (packages) and JabRef-portable-linux.tar.gz (untar & run)
- for MacOS: JabRef-5.0-dev.dmg & JabRef-5.0-dev.pck (packages) and JabRef-portable-macos.tar.gz (untar & run)
Thus
column2: we can provide an installer (or package) as well as a runable version for each OS.

column1: Link issues by using the following pattern: [#333](https://github.com/JabRef/jabref/issues/333) or [koppor#49](https://github.com/koppor/jabref/issues/47).

column1: The log4j appenders were not found. With the help of the log4j people
column2: this could be fixed by upgrading to the latest builds of log4j version 3
column3: see discussion at https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LOG4J2-2690. I feel somewhat uncomfortable using snapshot builds for our release
column4: but I guess we have no real choice here (at the moment the logger doesn't work at all). Concerning the stability
column5: I was informed that

column1: > The quality of it should be just as good as 2.x
column2: but one of the goals was to modularize it as much as possible. That work hasn't been completed. I also can't guarantee we won't change more stuff before it is released.

column1: I pinned the log4j snapshots to today's version. In this way
column2: we don't have to constantly change our code if they plan to do bigger refactorings on their side. We can always upgrade to a latter snapshot if we should discover a bug in the future.

This PR ha grown pretty huge too
column2: although there is nothing really complicated in it. The four very simple tabs are converted and I included some suggestions about templates/generics and icons @tobiasdiez made in [#5185 comment](https://github.com/JabRef/jabref/pull/5185#discussion_r322013878) and in [#5265](https://github.com/JabRef/jabref/pull/5265#discussion_r320335661).

column1: The SaveOrderConfigDisplay had to be refactored
column2: as there were some bugs: It did not want to set the values after resetting the preferences and it could not load the fields-class (crazy java9-module-stuff)
column3: so I also had to change some exports in the modules-info. There I also included some changes out of the gitter-discussion.

column1: I already got some ideas how to resort all the preferences and options in the options-menu
column2: One could change the ListView on the sidePane to a TreeView and start thinning each tab into small preferenceTabs. The help buttons could also be somehow adjusted for each tab at the same position. (maybe somewhere to the right of the title)

column1: I guess there are some things to be discussed or corected in this PR
column2: so im looking forward for your comments.

column1: 5318dependabot-preview[bot]27856297closed2019-09-16T07:14:23Z2019-09-16T07:30:49ZBump bcprov-jdk15on from 1.62 to 1.63"Bumps [bcprov-jdk15on](https://github.com/bcgit/bc-java) from 1.62 to 1.63.
<details>
<summary>Changelog</summary>
*Sourced from [bcprov-jdk15on's changelog](https://github.com/bcgit/bc-java/blob/master/docs/releasenotes.html).*
> <html>
> <head>
> <title>Bouncy Castle Crypto Package - Release Notes</title>
> </head>
> <body bgcolor=""#ffffff"" text=""[#000000](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/bcgit/bc-java/issues/000000)#"">
> <center>

>

Bouncy Castle Crypto Package - Release Notes
> <font size=1>
> <pre>
>
> </font>
> </center>

>

1.0 Introduction
> The Bouncy Castle Crypto package is a Java implementation of
> cryptographic algorithms.  The package is organised so that it
> contains a light-weight API suitable for use in any environment
> (including the J2ME) with the additional infrastructure
> to conform the algorithms to the JCE framework.

>

2.0 Release History

>

2.1.1 Version
> Release: 1.63
> Date:      2019
column2: September 10th.

column1:
>

2.1.2 Defects Fixed
> <ul>

>
  • The ASN.1 parser would throw a large object exception for some objects which could be safely parsed. This has been fixed.

>
  • GOST3412-2015 CTR mode was unusable at the JCE level. This has been fixed.

>
  • The DSTU MACs were failing to reset fully on doFinal(). This has been fixed.

>
  • The DSTU MACs would throw an exception if the key was a multiple of the size as the MAC's underlying buffer size. This has been fixed.
> <li>EdEC and QTESLA were not previously usable with the post Java 9 module structure. This is now fixed.

>
  • ECNR was not correctly bounds checking the input and could produce invalid signatures. This is now fixed.

>
  • ASN.1: Enforce no leading zeroes in OID branches (longer than 1 character).

>
  • TLS: Fix X448 support in JcaTlsCrypto.

>
  • Fixed field reduction for secp128r1 custom curve.

>
  • Fixed unsigned multiplications in X448 field squaring.

>
  • Some issues over subset Name Constraint validation in the CertPath analyser have now been fixed.

>
  • TimeStampResponse.getEncoded() could throw an exception if the TimeStampToken was null. This has been fixed.

>
  • Unnecessary memory usage in the ARGON2 implementation has been removed.

>
  • Param-Z in the GOST-28147 algorithm was not resolving correctly. This has been fixed.

>
  • It is now possible to specify different S-Box parameters for the GOST 28147-89 MAC.

>

2.1.3 Additional Features and Functionality
> <ul>
> <li>QTESLA is now updated with the round 2 changes. Note: the security catergories
column2: and in some cases key generation and signatures
column3: have changed. For people interested in comparison
column4: the round 1 version is now moved to org.bouncycastle.pqc.crypto.qteslarnd1 - this package will be deleted in 1.64. Please keep in mind that QTESLA may continue to evolve.

column1:
>
  • Support has been added for generating Ed25519/Ed448 signed certificates.
> ... (truncated)
</details>
<details>
<summary>Commits</summary>
- See full diff in [compare view](https://github.com/bcgit/bc-java/commits)
</details>

- `@dependabot ignore this minor version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this minor version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself)

5340matthiasgeiger676652closed2019-09-22T18:37:15Z2019-10-06T09:25:15ZFix various copy to clipboard issuesPt 1: Fixing #5263 by only using the text content to be added in the right-click-copy functionality in the preview (see https://github.com/JabRef/jabref/pull/5340/files#diff-b84aeae22f7f719bc60f1ae34ecb39f6)

column3: in case RTF or HTML content is exported the specific ClipboardContent has been used.

5341dependabot-preview[bot]27856297closed2019-09-23T08:07:55Z2019-11-11T20:25:30ZBump applicationinsights-core from 2.4.1 to 2.5.0Bumps [applicationinsights-core](https://github.com/Microsoft/ApplicationInsights-Java) from 2.4.1 to 2.5.0.
<details>
<summary>Release notes</summary>
*Sourced from [applicationinsights-core's releases](https://github.com/Microsoft/ApplicationInsights-Java/releases).*
> ## Application Insights Java SDK 2.5.0
> Announcing Application Insights Java SDK 2.5.0!
> There were no changes since 2.5.0-BETA.5.
> # Summary of Changes Since 2.4.x
> ## Enhancements
> ### SDK-wide
> - Added Java 9/10/11/12 support
> - Introduced new jar
column2: `applicationinsights-web-auto.jar`
column3: which automatically registers the web filter. No need to modify `web.xml` or add `@WebFilter`.

column1: > - Simplifies role name configuration by adding `<RoleName>` tag in `ApplicationInsights.xml`.
> ### New Agent Features
> - Generic JDBC driver support: captures JDBC queries for all JDBC drivers.
> - Automatically captures dependencies for async requests by tracking the request across multiple threads.
> - Agent now captures application logging from Log4j 2/1.2 and Logback.
>    * This removes the need to add the `applicationinsights-logging-*.jar` dependency and modify the application's logging configuration.
> - Improved HTTP client support:
>    * `java.net.HttpURLConnection`
>    * Apache HttpClient 3.x
>    * OkHttp3
>    * OkHttp2 now supports distributed tracing
> - Sets `Operation Name` automatically based on Spring `@RequestMapping`
column2: JAX-RS `@Path` and Struts action class/method name.

column1: >    * This removes the need for `RequestNameHandlerInterceptorAdapter` or other interceptors.
> - Agent now supports multiple applications deployed in the same application server (temporarily in the 2.4.0)
> - Simplified JBoss and Wildfly deployment when using the agent: no need for workarounds using `jboss.modules.system.pkgs`
column2: `java.util.logging.manager`
column3: `-Xbootclasspath`

column1: > - Added agent logging capture threshold
column2: configurable via `<Logging threshold=""warn"" />`

column1: >   in the `AI-Agent.xml`
column2: with default threshold `warn` ([#1026](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/Microsoft/ApplicationInsights-Java/issues/1026))

column1: > ## Removed/Deprecated
> - Removed support for `<RuntimeException>` custom instrumentation in `AI-Agent.xml`
> ## Bug Fixes
> - [#969](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/microsoft/ApplicationInsights-Java/issues/969) Fixes ability to configure Live Metrics iKey programatically.
> - [#978](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/microsoft/ApplicationInsights-Java/issues/978) Possible NPE during development
> - Fixed request telemetry displaying `200` response code for some failed requests ([#810](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/Microsoft/ApplicationInsights-Java/issues/810))
> - Fixed GC performance counters not working ([#929](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/Microsoft/ApplicationInsights-Java/issues/929))
> ## Miscellaneous
> - Starting with this release
column2: you can now find the agent and the collectd plugin on Maven Central as `applicationinsights-agent` and `applicationinsights-collectd` under the same group
column3: `com.microsoft.azure`.

> # Bug Fixes
> - Fixed `ClassCastException` that could happen when using `HttpURLConnection` ([#1053](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/Microsoft/ApplicationInsights-Java/issues/1053))
> ## Application Insights Java SDK 2.5.0-BETA.4
> Introducing Application Insights Java SDK 2.5.0-BETA.4!
> ... (truncated)
</details>
<details>
<summary>Changelog</summary>
*Sourced from [applicationinsights-core's changelog](https://github.com/microsoft/ApplicationInsights-Java/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md).*
> # Version 2.5.0
> * No changes since 2.5.0-BETA.5
> # Version 2.5.0-BETA.5
> - Fixed `ClassCastException` that could happen when using `HttpURLConnection`
>   ([#1053](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/microsoft/ApplicationInsights-Java/issues/1053))
> # Version 2.5.0-BETA.4
> - Fixed registration of custom JMX performance counters
>   ([#1042](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/microsoft/ApplicationInsights-Java/issues/1042))
> - Fixed `IllegalStateException` that could happen when using `HttpURLConnection`
>   ([#1037](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/microsoft/ApplicationInsights-Java/issues/1037))
> - Fixed `NullPointerException` that could happen when using Java 11
>   ([#1032](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/microsoft/ApplicationInsights-Java/issues/1032))
> # Version 2.5.0-BETA.3
> - Fixed `HttpURLConnection` instrumentation was not capturing outgoing url
>   ([#1025](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/microsoft/ApplicationInsights-Java/issues/1025))
> - Added agent logging capture threshold
column2: configurable via `<Logging threshold=""warn"" />`

column1: >   in the `AI-Agent.xml`
column2: with default threshold `warn`

column1: >   ([#1026](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/microsoft/ApplicationInsights-Java/issues/1026))
> - Fixed request telemetry displaying `200` response code for some failed requests
>   ([#810](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/microsoft/ApplicationInsights-Java/issues/810))
> - Fixed GC performance counters not working
>   ([#929](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/microsoft/ApplicationInsights-Java/issues/929))
> # Version 2.5.0-BETA.2
> - Added back support for `<Class>` custom instrumentation in `AI-Agent.xml`
> - Fixed opting out of agent capturing logging via `<Logging enabled=""false"" />`
> - Misc fixes [#969](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/microsoft/ApplicationInsights-Java/issues/969)
>              [#978](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/microsoft/ApplicationInsights-Java/issues/978)
> # Version 2.5.0-BETA
> - Added support for Java 9-12
> - Added new `applicationinsights-web-auto.jar` artifact that automatically registers the web filter
>   by just being present in your dependencies (works for both servlet containers and spring boot standalone)
>   - No need to modify `web.xml`
column2: or add `@WebFilter`

column1: > - Agent now captures application logging via `Log4j 1.2`

column1: >   - No need to add `applicationinsights-logging-*.jar` dependency and modify the application's logging configuration
>    (e.g. `log4j.properties`

column3: `logback.xml`)

column1: >   - To opt out of this (e.g. if you prefer to capture logging via the Application Insights appenders)
>     add `<Logging enabled=""false"" />` to the `AI-Agent.xml` file inside of the `Builtin` tag
> - Agent now automatically captures dependencies for async requests by tracking the request across multiple threads
> - Agent now captures JDBC queries for all JDBC drivers
> - Added additional HTTP client support
>   - `java.net.HttpURLConnection`
>   - Apache HttpClient 3.x (4.x was already previously supported)
>   - OkHttp3
>   - OkHttp2 (previously did not propagate distributed trace context)
> - Agent now sets `Operation Name` (used for aggregating similar requests) automatically

column1: 5344dependabot-preview[bot]27856297closed2019-09-23T08:09:49Z2019-11-11T10:09:55ZBump applicationinsights-logging-log4j2 from 2.4.1 to 2.5.0"Bumps [applicationinsights-logging-log4j2](https://github.com/Microsoft/ApplicationInsights-Java) from 2.4.1 to 2.5.0.
<details>
<summary>Release notes</summary>
*Sourced from [applicationinsights-logging-log4j2's releases](https://github.com/Microsoft/ApplicationInsights-Java/releases).*
> ## Application Insights Java SDK 2.5.0
> Announcing Application Insights Java SDK 2.5.0!
> There were no changes since 2.5.0-BETA.5.
> # Summary of Changes Since 2.4.x
> ## Enhancements
> ### SDK-wide
> - Added Java 9/10/11/12 support
> - Introduced new jar
column2: `applicationinsights-web-auto.jar`
column3: which automatically registers the web filter. No need to modify `web.xml` or add `@WebFilter`.

column1: > - Simplifies role name configuration by adding `<RoleName>` tag in `ApplicationInsights.xml`.
> ### New Agent Features
> - Generic JDBC driver support: captures JDBC queries for all JDBC drivers.
> - Automatically captures dependencies for async requests by tracking the request across multiple threads.
> - Agent now captures application logging from Log4j 2/1.2 and Logback.
>    * This removes the need to add the `applicationinsights-logging-*.jar` dependency and modify the application's logging configuration.
> - Improved HTTP client support:
>    * `java.net.HttpURLConnection`
>    * Apache HttpClient 3.x
>    * OkHttp3
>    * OkHttp2 now supports distributed tracing
> - Sets `Operation Name` automatically based on Spring `@RequestMapping`
column2: JAX-RS `@Path` and Struts action class/method name.

column1: >    * This removes the need for `RequestNameHandlerInterceptorAdapter` or other interceptors.
> - Agent now supports multiple applications deployed in the same application server (temporarily in the 2.4.0)
> - Simplified JBoss and Wildfly deployment when using the agent: no need for workarounds using `jboss.modules.system.pkgs`
column2: `java.util.logging.manager`
column3: `-Xbootclasspath`

column1: > - Added agent logging capture threshold
column2: configurable via `<Logging threshold=""warn"" />`

column1: >   in the `AI-Agent.xml`
column2: with default threshold `warn` ([#1026](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/Microsoft/ApplicationInsights-Java/issues/1026))

column1: > ## Removed/Deprecated
> - Removed support for `<RuntimeException>` custom instrumentation in `AI-Agent.xml`
> ## Bug Fixes
> - [#969](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/microsoft/ApplicationInsights-Java/issues/969) Fixes ability to configure Live Metrics iKey programatically.
> - [#978](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/microsoft/ApplicationInsights-Java/issues/978) Possible NPE during development
> - Fixed request telemetry displaying `200` response code for some failed requests ([#810](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/Microsoft/ApplicationInsights-Java/issues/810))
> - Fixed GC performance counters not working ([#929](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/Microsoft/ApplicationInsights-Java/issues/929))
> ## Miscellaneous
> - Starting with this release
column2: you can now find the agent and the collectd plugin on Maven Central as `applicationinsights-agent` and `applicationinsights-collectd` under the same group
column3: `com.microsoft.azure`.

column1: > ## Application Insights Java SDK 2.5.0-BETA.5
> Introducing Application Insights Java SDK 2.5.0-BETA.5!
> # Bug Fixes
> - Fixed `ClassCastException` that could happen when using `HttpURLConnection` ([#1053](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/Microsoft/ApplicationInsights-Java/issues/1053))
> ## Application Insights Java SDK 2.5.0-BETA.4
> Introducing Application Insights Java SDK 2.5.0-BETA.4!
> ... (truncated)
</details>
<details>
<summary>Changelog</summary>
*Sourced from [applicationinsights-logging-log4j2's changelog](https://github.com/microsoft/ApplicationInsights-Java/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md).*
> # Version 2.5.0
> * No changes since 2.5.0-BETA.5
> # Version 2.5.0-BETA.5
> - Fixed `ClassCastException` that could happen when using `HttpURLConnection`
>   ([#1053](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/microsoft/ApplicationInsights-Java/issues/1053))
> # Version 2.5.0-BETA.4
> - Fixed registration of custom JMX performance counters
>   ([#1042](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/microsoft/ApplicationInsights-Java/issues/1042))
> - Fixed `IllegalStateException` that could happen when using `HttpURLConnection`
>   ([#1037](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/microsoft/ApplicationInsights-Java/issues/1037))
> - Fixed `NullPointerException` that could happen when using Java 11
>   ([#1032](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/microsoft/ApplicationInsights-Java/issues/1032))
> # Version 2.5.0-BETA.3
> - Fixed `HttpURLConnection` instrumentation was not capturing outgoing url
>   ([#1025](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/microsoft/ApplicationInsights-Java/issues/1025))
> - Added agent logging capture threshold
column2: configurable via `<Logging threshold=""warn"" />`

column1: >   in the `AI-Agent.xml`
column2: with default threshold `warn`

column1: >   ([#1026](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/microsoft/ApplicationInsights-Java/issues/1026))
> - Fixed request telemetry displaying `200` response code for some failed requests
>   ([#810](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/microsoft/ApplicationInsights-Java/issues/810))
> - Fixed GC performance counters not working
>   ([#929](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/microsoft/ApplicationInsights-Java/issues/929))
> # Version 2.5.0-BETA.2
> - Added back support for `<Class>` custom instrumentation in `AI-Agent.xml`
> - Fixed opting out of agent capturing logging via `<Logging enabled=""false"" />`
> - Misc fixes [#969](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/microsoft/ApplicationInsights-Java/issues/969)
>              [#978](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/microsoft/ApplicationInsights-Java/issues/978)
> # Version 2.5.0-BETA
> - Added support for Java 9-12
> - Added new `applicationinsights-web-auto.jar` artifact that automatically registers the web filter
>   by just being present in your dependencies (works for both servlet containers and spring boot standalone)
>   - No need to modify `web.xml`
column2: or add `@WebFilter`

column1: > - Agent now captures application logging via `Log4j 1.2`
column2: `Log4j2` and `Logback`

column1: >   - No need to add `applicationinsights-logging-*.jar` dependency and modify the application's logging configuration
>    (e.g. `log4j.properties`
column2: `log4j2.xml`
column3: `logback.xml`)

column1: >   - To opt out of this (e.g. if you prefer to capture logging via the Application Insights appenders)
>     add `<Logging enabled=""false"" />` to the `AI-Agent.xml` file inside of the `Builtin` tag
> - Agent now automatically captures dependencies for async requests by tracking the request across multiple threads
> - Agent now captures JDBC queries for all JDBC drivers
> - Added additional HTTP client support
>   - `java.net.HttpURLConnection`
>   - Apache HttpClient 3.x (4.x was already previously supported)
>   - OkHttp3
>   - OkHttp2 (previously did not propagate distributed trace context)
> - Agent now sets `Operation Name` (used for aggregating similar requests) automatically
> ... (truncated)
</details>

- `@dependabot ignore this major version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this major version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself)
- `@dependabot ignore this minor version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this minor version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself)
- `@dependabot ignore this dependency` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this dependency (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself)
- `@dependabot badge me` will comment on this PR with code to add a ""Dependabot enabled"" badge to your readme
Additionally
column2: you can set the following in the `.dependabot/config.yml` file in this repo:

column1: - Update frequency
- Automerge options (never/patch/minor
column2: and dev/runtime dependencies)

column1: - Out-of-range updates (receive only lockfile updates
column2: if desired)

column1: - Security updates (receive only security updates
column2: if desired)

column1: Finally
column2: you can contact us by mentioning @dependabot.

5395tobiasdiez5037600closed2019-10-06T07:56:05Z2019-10-06T11:41:31ZFix exception when merging entriesThe problem was that `sourceChanged` was invoked asynchronous and thus the information in the change event could be obsolete if another thread changed the underlying list in the meantime. Solution: run `sourceChanged` on the JavaFX thread but synchronously.
Fixes #5169.

5402dependabot-preview[bot]27856297closed2019-10-07T09:28:28Z2019-10-07T10:58:30ZBump mariadb-java-client from 2.4.4 to 2.5.0Bumps [mariadb-java-client](https://github.com/MariaDB/mariadb-connector-j) from 2.4.4 to 2.5.0.
<details>
<summary>Release notes</summary>
*Sourced from [mariadb-java-client's releases](https://github.com/MariaDB/mariadb-connector-j/releases).*
> ## MariaDB java connector 2.5.0
> This version is a general availability (GA) release.
> ## Changelog
> * [CONJ-663] Client authentication plugins are now defined as services. The driver has 2 new plugins `caching_sha2_password` and `sha256_password plugin` for MySQL compatibility
> * [CONJ-733] Credential service: AWS IAM authentication
> * [CONJ-727] Support configuration of custom SSLSocketFactory
> * [CONJ-561] JDBC 4.3 partial implementation java.sql.Statement methods isSimpleIdentifier
column2: enquoteIdentifier
column3: enquoteLiteral and enquoteNCharLiteral

column1: > * [CONJ-692] ConnectionPoolDataSource interface addition to MariaDbPoolDataSource
> * [CONJ-563] closing possible option batch thread on driver deregistration.
> * [CONJ-732] Driver getPropertyInfo returns no options information when url is empty
> * [CONJ-734] DatabaseMetaData.getSchemaTerm now return ""schema""
column2: not empty string

column1: </details>
<details>

column1: Originally
column2: my goal was to aggregate remote database queries for batch insertions and deletions
column3: but in doing this
column4: I discovered that it might simplify the code more in general if I combined `EntryEvent`s together for these in local databases as well. Currently
column5: I am in the process of combining `EntryRemovedEvent`s into an `EntriesRemovedEvent`. Only one event would be fired if you removed multiple entries from the local database at a time. I haven't written unit tests for it yet or done any other testing
column6: and my work so far was largely just to experiment with what parts of the code base I would have to change. There is still a lot of work to be done.

5436vpbhargav9023876closed2019-10-12T22:16:09Z2019-10-13T18:33:58ZRemove jacoco append property[ #5428](https://github.com/JabRef/jabref/issues/5428) - Issue this PR solves
Gradle was warning about deprecated feature usage. Logs show jacoco append to be the feature that is deprecated.From my understandind the propery is currently ignored.
Removed the Jacoco append property from build.gradle and builds don't throw any deprecation warnings anymore.

The append property in Jacoco is meant to write to the same coverage file. But as mentioned in this [issue](https://github.com/gradle/gradle/issues/5269) setting it to true broke the build caching capability. So starting Gradle 5.0 a breaking change was introduced where they did away with the append property. The default behavior was set to behave as if append is initially false to enable build caching and then append is set to true before passing to the jacoco agent.

This meant that multiple tasks could not use the same coverage file but Jacoco merge is a feature that let's you achieve the same functionality. The gradle for the project does use Jacoco Merge to merge the various .exec file results
column2: so removing the append property should not break coverage.

5439Brainsucker928946793closed2019-10-13T18:29:00Z2019-10-15T17:07:46ZJabRefExecutorService improvementI made a very minor update on the current JabRefExecutorService to support the very modern way of handling asynchronous tasks by using CompletableFuture objects. Using CompletableFuture instad of the usual Future object allows chaining of several asynchronous tasks very easily. This is a much more flexible way of dealing with asynchronous operations. I highly recomment using those methods I added instead of the old ones.
For those that are unfamiliar with the CompletableFuture pattern
column2: they might want to have a look at my personal [project](https://github.com/Brainsucker92/picalculator/blob/master/src/main/java/calculator/impl/ChudnovskyCalculator.java) where I used this to split and chain some very expensive calculations which gave me a very simple but huge increase in throughput.

column1: **REQUIRES TESTING!**
I removed unnecessary field dependencies from the `AbbreviateAction` class to make it much more flexible to use. There is no longer a `BasePanel` required to abbreviate BibEntries.
Also I split up the relatively big abbreviation task into a lot of smaller tasks
column2: which increase concurrency a lot (divide and conquer FTW!)

column1: Important events during the abbreviation process can now be listened to via the `AbbreviateActionListener` interface or `AbbreviateActionAdapter` class.
Unfortunately I cannot test any of the changes since I don't have any big database to run an abbreviation on.
Is there any testing data available?

column1: 5443dependabot-preview[bot]27856297closed2019-10-14T13:08:17Z2019-10-14T20:10:45ZBump bcprov-jdk15on from 1.63 to 1.64"Bumps [bcprov-jdk15on](https://github.com/bcgit/bc-java) from 1.63 to 1.64.
<details>
<summary>Changelog</summary>
*Sourced from [bcprov-jdk15on's changelog](https://github.com/bcgit/bc-java/blob/master/docs/releasenotes.html).*
> <html>
> <head>
> <title>Bouncy Castle Crypto Package - Release Notes</title>
> </head>
> <body bgcolor=""#ffffff"" text=""[#000000](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/bcgit/bc-java/issues/000000)#"">
> <center>

>

Bouncy Castle Crypto Package - Release Notes
> <font size=1>
> <pre>
>
> </font>
> </center>

>

1.0 Introduction
> The Bouncy Castle Crypto package is a Java implementation of
> cryptographic algorithms.  The package is organised so that it
> contains a light-weight API suitable for use in any environment
> (including the J2ME) with the additional infrastructure
> to conform the algorithms to the JCE framework.

>

2.0 Release History

>

2.1.1 Version
> Release: 1.64
> Date:      2019
column2: October 7th.

column1:
>

2.1.2 Defects Fixed
> <ul>

>
  • OpenSSH: Fixed padding in generated Ed25519 private keys.

>
  • Validation of headers in PemReader now looks for tailing dashes in header.

>
  • PKIXNameConstraintValidator was throwing a NullPointerException on OtherName. This has been fixed.

>
  • Some compatibility issues around the signature encryption algorithm field in CMS SignedData and the GOST algorithms have been addressed.

>
  • GOST3410-2012-512 now uses the GOST3411-2012-256 as its KDF digest.

>

2.1.3 Additional Features and Functionality
> <ul>

>
  • PKCS12 key stores key stores containing only certificates can now be created without the need to provide passwords.

>
  • BCJSSE: Initial support for AlgorithmConstraints; protocol versions and cipher suites.

>
  • BCJSSE: Initial support for 'jdk.tls.disabledAlgorithms'; protocol versions and cipher suites.

>
  • BCJSSE: Add SecurityManager check to access session context.

>
  • BCJSSE: Improved SunJSSE compatibility of the NULL_SESSION.

>
  • BCJSSE: SSLContext algorithms updated for SunJSSE compatibility (default enabled protocols).

>
  • The digest functions Haraka-256 and Haraka-512 have been added to the provider and the light-weight API

>
  • XMSS/XMSS^MT key management now allows for allocating subsets of the private key space using the extraKeyShard() method. Use of StateAwareSignature is now deprecated.

>
  • Support for Java 11's NamedParameterSpec class has been added (using reflection) to the EC and EdEC KeyPairGenerator implementations.

>

2.1.4 Security Advisory
> <ul>
> ... (truncated)
</details>

5450LinusDietz1254003closed2019-10-15T14:35:34Z2019-10-17T13:01:40ZDisable stacktrace on errorThis reverts a change introduced by a bot without even mentioning it in the commit message. https://github.com/JabRef/jabref/commit/4add3167c918dc2b6c33f55a5a8aff70cb5f2bed#diff-c197962302397baf3a4cc36463dce5eaR39
I'd argue that quite often we don't want to see the full stack trace of Gradle. The motivating example for this was checking the outdated dependencies. We do have a error message for this
column2: `There are outdated dependencies in build.gradle!\n Run ./gradlew dependencyUpdates to see which`
column3: but the stacktrace still appeared and distracted from the normal error message.

5482davidemdot12954316closed2019-10-19T04:47:12Z2019-10-27T14:28:25ZAdd X11 Primary Selection clipboard support_Related to issue #2389 (**JabRef and the X Window clipboard/selections**)._
I have been testing different alternatives and I think that this is the best choice (for using `XClipboard` a new dependency is needed
column2: and it does not give any added value).

column1: - All contents that JabRef sends to the system clipboard will be available in the X11 Primary clipboard too (i.e.
column2: `copyVersionToClipboard()` in the About dialog). So it is possible to paste it in a text editor
column3: doing click in the middle/third mouse button.

column1: ![copy_version](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12954316/67137766-aca48980-f23a-11e9-9bf0-a96ee1ef920f.gif)
- It is necessary to call the `install()` method in every text field where you want to use it. For the moment
column2: it is activated in the `GlobalSearchBar`
column3: therefore you can try it: write something
column4: select a piece of text and do click in the middle button.

column1: ![global_search](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12954316/67137765-ab735c80-f23a-11e9-8f17-2015c9833a20.gif)
- Now `ClipBoardManager` uses the singleton pattern. It is instantiated once in `Globals.java`.
Any feedback will be more than welcome! **:""D**

column1: 5490dependabot-preview[bot]27856297closed2019-10-21T07:38:49Z2019-10-21T08:11:48ZBump classgraph from 4.8.48 to 4.8.52"Bumps [classgraph](https://github.com/classgraph/classgraph) from 4.8.48 to 4.8.52.
<details>
<summary>Release notes</summary>
*Sourced from [classgraph's releases](https://github.com/classgraph/classgraph/releases).*
> ## classgraph-4.8.52
> Remove the shutdown hook entirely ([#376](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/classgraph/classgraph/issues/376)).
> A shutdown hook has been in place for numerous releases
column2: and its purpose was to call `ScanResult#close()` on any open `ScanResult` instances before JVM shutdown
column3: in order to free up resources (delete any temporary files that had to be created to extract deflated nested jars; unmap mapped byte buffers; close open modules; close open files; free up allocated memory; etc.). However the JVM's own shutdown processes should take care of all of these steps
column4: including the removal of any temporary files that are created
column5: as they are marked for deletion on JVM shutdown. More importantly
column6: `ScanResult` implements `Autocloseable`
column7: and the ClassGraph documentation strongly recommends assigning `ScanResult` in a try-with-resources block so that each `ScanResult` is properly closed
column8: so the shutdown hook was always just a fallback.

column1: > If you want to close all open (unclosed) `ScanResult` instances at once
column2: you can call the new static method `ScanResult.closeAll()`. You might want to do this on container unload/destroy
column3: in a containerized runtime.

column1: > ClassGraph automatically registers lifecycle listeners for [servlet](https://github.com/classgraph/classgraph/blob/master/src/main/java/nonapi/io/github/classgraph/classloaderhandler/lifecycle/ServletLifeCycleListener.java) containers and [Spring](https://github.com/classgraph/classgraph/blob/master/src/main/java/nonapi/io/github/classgraph/classloaderhandler/lifecycle/SpringLifeCycleListener.java) applications that call `ScanResult.closeAll()`
column2: to ensure that resources are properly freed when containers are destroyed or unloaded.

column1: > Note that if you call `ScanResult.closeAll()`
column2: you need to ensure that the lifecycle of the classloader matches the lifecycle of your application
column3: or that two concurrent applications don't share the same classloader
column4: otherwise one application might close another application's `ScanResult` instances while they are still in use.

column1: > ## classgraph-4.8.51
> In servlet containers and Spring applications
column2: rather than adding a shutdown hook to close any unclosed `ScanResult` objects (to prevent resource leaks)
column3: instead add an event listener that closes unclosed `ScanResult` objects when the container is being torn down. This prevents a leak of the container's classloader ([#376](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/classgraph/classgraph/issues/376)
column4: thanks to [@​vimil](https://github.com/vimil) for reporting).

column1: > Please report any regressions with servlet containers or Spring.
> ## classgraph-4.8.50
> No new functionality; only fixes static analysis warnings (switched on Eclipse JDT's nullability analysis warnings; fixed all warnings).
> ## classgraph-4.8.49
> Fix `getClassInfo() cannot be called here` exception for `BaseTypeSignature` triggered by having an annotation with an array of primitive type references
column2: e.g. `@MyAnnotation({ int.class })`. Thanks to [@​johndevs](https://github.com/johndevs) for reporting ([#375](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/classgraph/classgraph/issues/375)).

column1: </details>

column1: 5493dependabot-preview[bot]27856297closed2019-10-21T07:40:39Z2019-10-21T08:09:37ZBump byte-buddy-parent from 1.10.1 to 1.10.2"Bumps [byte-buddy-parent](https://github.com/raphw/byte-buddy) from 1.10.1 to 1.10.2.
<details>
<summary>Release notes</summary>
*Sourced from [byte-buddy-parent's releases](https://github.com/raphw/byte-buddy/releases).*
> ## Byte Buddy 1.10.2
> - Upgrade ASM to version 7.2.

5531koppor1366654closed2019-10-27T19:26:19Z2019-10-28T22:58:39ZAdd tests for month issue and strings (and some minor code impr…I wanted to dive into https://github.com/JabRef/jabref/pull/5283 and finish it. I saw that we have no tests for `month = apr` (which is rendered internally as `#apr#`). We also did not cover the examples of https://github.com/JabRef/help.jabref.org/blob/gh-pages/en/Strings.md in test.
This is fixed here. I also did some cleaning in BibEntry. See below for details:
- Add tests for `month = apr` and `month = ""apr""`
- Add tests for JabRef's string types
- Remove Optional as method parameter in BibEntry.setField
- Add builder to BibEntry
- Mark ""BIBTEX_STRING"" as JabRef-internal field
- Sort constants in InternalField.java - and add some comments

JabRef should store instead in the columnPreferences not the fields

column3: that the user is able to have a clickable uri-column ""linked_id"" in one column

I'm copying my comment from the issue page:
I found that in BracketedPattern.java on line 846 the comma is removed and therefore the AuthorList is not correct.
https://github.com/JabRef/jabref/blob/master/src/main/java/org/jabref/logic/bibtexkeypattern/BracketedPattern.java#L846
I would fix this issue by not applying BibtexKeyGenerator.removeUnwantedCharacters before extracting the author but afterwards. The tests pass

column1: This pull request updates citeproc-java to version 2.0.0. The new version uses GraalVM JavaScript on Java 11 and higher
column2: so it should be significantly faster than the older one. Also
column3: the internal citeproc-js process has been updated to the latest version.

column1: I needed to add a `--add-exports` argument to make the module `com.oracle.truffle.regex` export the package `com.oracle.truffle.regex` to `org.graalvm.truffle`. Otherwise
column2: the polyglot engine was not able to find the `regex` language. This might be a bug in GraalVM (i.e. a missing `exports` statement in the `org.graalvm.truffle` module). I opened an issue for that (https://github.com/oracle/graal/issues/1822).

<details>
<summary>Release notes</summary>
*Sourced from [classgraph's releases](https://github.com/classgraph/classgraph/releases).*
> ## classgraph-4.8.53
> * Exposed raw type descriptor and/or type signature strings for methods
column2: fields and classes ([#380](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/classgraph/classgraph/issues/380)):

column1: >   * `MethodInfo#getTypeDescriptorStr()`
>   * `MethodInfo#getTypeSignatureStr()`
>   * `MethodInfo#getTypeSignatureOrTypeDescriptorStr()`
>   * `FieldInfo#getTypeDescriptorStr()`
>   * `FieldInfo#getTypeSignatureStr()`
>   * `FieldInfo#getTypeSignatureOrTypeDescriptorStr()`
>   * `ClassInfo#getTypeSignatureStr()`
> * Removed `static final` check on fields before scanning for constant initializer values
column2: to allow constant initializers to be read for non-static / non-final fields in Kotlin. (Java does not generate these
column3: and technically Kotlin should not either
column4: but one user relies on this in their Kotlin API -- [#379](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/classgraph/classgraph/issues/379).)

column1: > Thanks to [@​rankinc](https://github.com/rankinc) for both these feature requests!
