column1: 5595dependabot-preview[bot]27856297closed2019-11-11T10:09:18Z2019-11-11T10:37:57ZBump archunit-junit5-api from 0.11.0 to 0.12.0"Bumps [archunit-junit5-api](https://github.com/TNG/ArchUnit) from 0.11.0 to 0.12.0.
<details>
<summary>Release notes</summary>
*Sourced from [archunit-junit5-api's releases](https://github.com/TNG/ArchUnit/releases).*
> ## ArchUnit 0.12.0
> # Breaking Changes

> * So far ArchUnit's terminology has been a little sloppy with respect to the naming of inner and nested classes. By the [JLS](https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se13/html/jls-8.html#jls-8.1.3) ""inner classes"" are those classes that are nested and not static. ArchUnit's API now reflects this via `JavaClass.isNestedClass()` versus `JavaClass.isInnerClass()`. Unfortunately this means that the method formerly called `JavaClass.isInnerClass()` will now return a different result
column2: i.e. it will only return `true`
column3: if the class is non-static. On the other hand
column4: the method `JavaClass.isNestedClass()` will behave exactly like `isInnerClass()` did in ArchUnit 0.11.0 (see [#224](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/TNG/ArchUnit/issues/224); thanks a lot to [@​rweisleder](https://github.com/rweisleder) for the clarification and PR)

column1: > * `JavaAccessCondition` does not filter self-accesses anymore. This was confusing behavior that did not solve the issue it was originally intended for. However
column2: this might lead to additional violations showing up (see [#209](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/TNG/ArchUnit/issues/209))

column1: > # Bug Fixes

> * Fixed bug where simple name of local classes was incorrect (see [#216](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/TNG/ArchUnit/issues/216); thanks a lot to [@​rweisleder](https://github.com/rweisleder))
> * `static` modifier was missing from nested classes (see [#219](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/TNG/ArchUnit/issues/219); thanks a lot to [@​rweisleder](https://github.com/rweisleder))
> # Enhancements
> ## Core
> * Support for Java 14 (see [#230](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/TNG/ArchUnit/issues/230); thanks a lot to [@​hankem](https://github.com/hankem))

> * `JavaModifier` now contains `SYNTHETIC` and `BRIDGE` allowing more introspection and filtering of synthetic members (see [#243](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/TNG/ArchUnit/issues/243); thanks a lot to [@​alexfedorenchik](https://github.com/alexfedorenchik))
> * Every property in `archunit.properties` can now be overwritten by passing a system property. This can be valuable in CI environments
column2: e.g. to specify the `ViolationStore` path for `FreezingArchRule`. Compare the [user guide](https://www.archunit.org/userguide/html/000_Index.html#_overriding_configuration) (see [#252](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/TNG/ArchUnit/issues/252))

column1: > * A `JavaClass` representing an array can now be queried for its component type (see [#187](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/TNG/ArchUnit/issues/187); thanks a lot to [@​alexfedorenchik](https://github.com/alexfedorenchik))

> * `JavaClass` now offers a classpath independent version of `getMethod(..)` and `getConstructor(..)` (see [#236](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/TNG/ArchUnit/issues/236); thanks a lot to [@​rweisleder](https://github.com/rweisleder))
> ## Lang

> * Extended syntax for `classes().thatAreEnums()` and `classes()...should().beEnums()` (see [#172](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/TNG/ArchUnit/issues/172); thanks a lot to [@​rweisleder](https://github.com/rweisleder))
> ## Library
> * `LayeredArchitecture` now also checks that no layer is empty. While originally with good intentions
column2: the ability to define empty layers turned out to do more harm than good (see [#177](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/TNG/ArchUnit/issues/177); thanks a lot to [@​mikomatic](https://github.com/mikomatic))

column1: > * `LayeredArchitecture` now allows layers to be defined by predicate. This allows for a way more flexible definition than simple package patterns (see [#228](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/TNG/ArchUnit/issues/228); thanks a lot to [@​mikomatic](https://github.com/mikomatic))
> * `FreezingArchRule` can now be configured to be more strict
column2: when checking rules. In particular it is possible to forbid updates of the `ViolationStore` or the creation of a new `ViolationStore`. This can serve as a safeguard in CI environments
column3: where a missing `ViolationStore` is typically a misconfiguration. Compare the [user guide](https://www.archunit.org/userguide/html/000_Index.html#_configuration) (see [#211](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/TNG/ArchUnit/issues/211); thanks a lot to [@​hankem](https://github.com/hankem) for reviewing and providing valuable improvements)

column1: </details>
<details>

- [`d63d927`](https://github.com/TNG/ArchUnit/commit/d63d927de9b137c278a1b165c3057154288e7bd8) Review: Add convenience method for cases where we know this type is an array ...
- [`b10dde6`](https://github.com/TNG/ArchUnit/commit/b10dde649f2cda04c8f567da70fdb97c8bbe573b) Review: We have to always ensure the whole component type chain is present. B...
- [`ac545fb`](https://github.com/TNG/ArchUnit/commit/ac545fba42e522f189c14a39cd82da194938ca82) Review: Simplify test assertion by using ArchUnit infrastructure and Guava As...
- [`7507180`](https://github.com/TNG/ArchUnit/commit/75071805f74b9989711d4a7f59a42ee7136d7595) Offer a way to retrieve the component type of a `JavaClass` that is an array.

</details>

column1: 5596dependabot-preview[bot]27856297closed2019-11-11T10:09:47Z2019-11-11T20:24:50ZBump applicationinsights-logging-log4j2 from 2.4.1 to 2.5.1"Bumps [applicationinsights-logging-log4j2](https://github.com/Microsoft/ApplicationInsights-Java) from 2.4.1 to 2.5.1.
<details>
<summary>Release notes</summary>
*Sourced from [applicationinsights-logging-log4j2's releases](https://github.com/Microsoft/ApplicationInsights-Java/releases).*
> ## Application Insights Java SDK 2.5.1
> Announcing Application Insights Java SDK 2.5.1!
> There were no changes since 2.5.1-BETA.2.
> # Changes Since 2.5.0
> ## Enhancements
> * Connection String introduced for better government cloud support
> * Agent now captures MongoDB queries
> ## Bug Fixes
> * Fixed exception thrown by agent when using Apache HttpClient ResponseHandler methods ([#1067](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/Microsoft/ApplicationInsights-Java/issues/1067))
> * Fixed async thread tracking ([#1100](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/Microsoft/ApplicationInsights-Java/issues/1100))
> ## Application Insights Java SDK 2.5.1-BETA.2
> Introducing Application Insights Java SDK 2.5.1-BETA.2!
> # Bug Fixes
> * Fixed QuickPulse URL construction; regression from 2.5.1-BETA ([#1089](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/Microsoft/ApplicationInsights-Java/issues/1089))
> * Fixed async thread tracking ([#1100](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/Microsoft/ApplicationInsights-Java/issues/1100))
> ## Application Insights Java SDK 2.5.1-BETA
> Introducing Application Insights Java SDK 2.5.1-BETA!
> # Enhancements
> - Connection String introduced for better government cloud support
> - Agent now captures MongoDB queries
> # Bug Fixes
> - Fixed exception thrown by agent when using Apache HttpClient ResponseHandler methods ([#1067](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/Microsoft/ApplicationInsights-Java/issues/1067))
> ## Application Insights Java SDK 2.5.0
> Announcing Application Insights Java SDK 2.5.0!
> There were no changes since 2.5.0-BETA.5.
> # Summary of Changes Since 2.4.x
> ## Enhancements
> ### SDK-wide
> - Added Java 9/10/11/12 support
> - Introduced new jar
column2: `applicationinsights-web-auto.jar`
column3: which automatically registers the web filter. No need to modify `web.xml` or add `@WebFilter`.

column1: > - Simplifies role name configuration by adding `<RoleName>` tag in `ApplicationInsights.xml`.
> ### New Agent Features
> - Generic JDBC driver support: captures JDBC queries for all JDBC drivers.
> - Automatically captures dependencies for async requests by tracking the request across multiple threads.
> - Agent now captures application logging from Log4j 2/1.2 and Logback.
>    * This removes the need to add the `applicationinsights-logging-*.jar` dependency and modify the application's logging configuration.
> - Improved HTTP client support:
> ... (truncated)
</details>
<details>
<summary>Changelog</summary>
*Sourced from [applicationinsights-logging-log4j2's changelog](https://github.com/microsoft/ApplicationInsights-Java/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md).*
> # Version 2.5.1
> * No changes since 2.5.1-BETA.2
> # Version 2.5.1-BETA.2
> * Fixed regression from 2.5.1-BETA ([#1089](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/microsoft/ApplicationInsights-Java/issues/1089))
> * Fixed async thread tracking ([#1100](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/microsoft/ApplicationInsights-Java/pull/1100))
> # Version 2.5.1-BETA
> * Fixed exception thrown by agent when using Apache HttpClient ResponseHandler methods
>   ([#1067](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/microsoft/ApplicationInsights-Java/issues/1067))
> * Connection String introduced for better government cloud support
> * Agent now captures MongoDB queries
> # Version 2.5.0
> * No changes since 2.5.0-BETA.5
> # Version 2.5.0-BETA.5
> - Fixed `ClassCastException` that could happen when using `HttpURLConnection`
>   ([#1053](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/microsoft/ApplicationInsights-Java/issues/1053))
> # Version 2.5.0-BETA.4
> - Fixed registration of custom JMX performance counters
>   ([#1042](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/microsoft/ApplicationInsights-Java/issues/1042))
> - Fixed `IllegalStateException` that could happen when using `HttpURLConnection`
>   ([#1037](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/microsoft/ApplicationInsights-Java/issues/1037))
> - Fixed `NullPointerException` that could happen when using Java 11
>   ([#1032](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/microsoft/ApplicationInsights-Java/issues/1032))
> # Version 2.5.0-BETA.3
> - Fixed `HttpURLConnection` instrumentation was not capturing outgoing url
>   ([#1025](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/microsoft/ApplicationInsights-Java/issues/1025))
> - Added agent logging capture threshold
column2: configurable via `<Logging threshold=""warn"" />`

column1: >   in the `AI-Agent.xml`
column2: with default threshold `warn`

column1: >   ([#1026](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/microsoft/ApplicationInsights-Java/issues/1026))
> - Fixed request telemetry displaying `200` response code for some failed requests
>   ([#810](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/microsoft/ApplicationInsights-Java/issues/810))
> - Fixed GC performance counters not working
>   ([#929](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/microsoft/ApplicationInsights-Java/issues/929))
> # Version 2.5.0-BETA.2
> - Added back support for `<Class>` custom instrumentation in `AI-Agent.xml`
> - Fixed opting out of agent capturing logging via `<Logging enabled=""false"" />`
> - Misc fixes [#969](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/microsoft/ApplicationInsights-Java/issues/969)
>              [#978](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/microsoft/ApplicationInsights-Java/issues/978)
> # Version 2.5.0-BETA
> - Added support for Java 9-12
> - Added new `applicationinsights-web-auto.jar` artifact that automatically registers the web filter
>   by just being present in your dependencies (works for both servlet containers and spring boot standalone)
>   - No need to modify `web.xml`
column2: or add `@WebFilter`

column1: 5629Ka0o04035371closed2019-11-17T21:19:23Z2019-11-18T11:34:47ZFix #5615 side pane not remembering position"Hi
I found a bug where JavaFx was doing some recalculations during the initial layouting.
Setting `setResizableWithParent` before initial layouting was finished resulted in JavaFx assuming a wrong fixed width.
I changed that by adding the code to a run later block.
It works good for me on Mac. Are there any concerns with that?
Best regards
Kai

5648dependabot[bot]49699333closed2019-11-20T15:44:56Z2019-11-20T20:03:14ZBump nokogiri from 1.10.3 to 1.10.4 in /src/main/resources/csl-styles"Bumps [nokogiri](https://github.com/sparklemotion/nokogiri) from 1.10.3 to 1.10.4.
<details>
<summary>Release notes</summary>
*Sourced from [nokogiri's releases](https://github.com/sparklemotion/nokogiri/releases).*
> ### Security
> #### Address CVE-2019-5477 ([#1915](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/sparklemotion/nokogiri/issues/1915))

> A command injection vulnerability in Nokogiri v1.10.3 and earlier allows commands to be executed in a subprocess by Ruby's `Kernel.open` method. Processes are vulnerable only if the undocumented method `Nokogiri::CSS::Tokenizer#load_file` is being passed untrusted user input.

> This vulnerability appears in code generated by the Rexical gem versions v1.0.6 and earlier. Rexical is used by Nokogiri to generate lexical scanner code for parsing CSS queries. The underlying vulnerability was addressed in Rexical v1.0.7 and Nokogiri upgraded to this version of Rexical in Nokogiri v1.10.4.
> This CVE's public notice is [sparklemotion/nokogiri#1915](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/sparklemotion/nokogiri/issues/1915)
</details>
<details>
<summary>Changelog</summary>
*Sourced from [nokogiri's changelog](https://github.com/sparklemotion/nokogiri/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md).*
> ### Security
> #### Address CVE-2019-5477 ([#1915](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/sparklemotion/nokogiri/issues/1915))

> A command injection vulnerability in Nokogiri v1.10.3 and earlier allows commands to be executed in a subprocess by Ruby's `Kernel.open` method. Processes are vulnerable only if the undocumented method `Nokogiri::CSS::Tokenizer#load_file` is being passed untrusted user input.

> This vulnerability appears in code generated by the Rexical gem versions v1.0.6 and earlier. Rexical is used by Nokogiri to generate lexical scanner code for parsing CSS queries. The underlying vulnerability was addressed in Rexical v1.0.7 and Nokogiri upgraded to this version of Rexical in Nokogiri v1.10.4.
> This CVE's public notice is [sparklemotion/nokogiri#1915](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/sparklemotion/nokogiri/issues/1915)
</details>

5665tobiasdiez5037600closed2019-11-23T11:22:58Z2019-11-28T19:39:53ZImprove change scannerIf a file is changed externally
column2: JabRef is doing a 3-way merge between the last saved value vs current value in JabRef vs new value in file.

column1: The way this is done is by first comparing the last saved file with the current (changed) file
column2: and then trying to find additional/other changes in the currently open database. This is really complex and I believe there is some subtle bug in the logic leading to #5257.

column1: With this PR
column2: the change scanner is changed to a to simple 2-way merge between the current value in JabRef vs new value in file. This is way simpler and I hope this PR fixes #5257.

column1: In a few edge cases
column2: the 2-way merge has a small disadvantage. For example
column3: consider the following steps:

column1: - User A opens file
- User A changes field `Author` to `User A` and adds field `Title` with value `new`
- User B opens file
- User B changes field `Author` to `User B`
- User B saves file
At this point
column2: User A gets a message that the file changed with the following changes:

column1: - field `Author` changed from `User A` to `User B`
- field `Title` was removed
The 3-way merge could detect that `Title` was newly added
column2: and thus could automatically reapply this change.  This is no longer possible with the simple 2-way merge.

5669koppor1366654open2019-11-24T11:11:21Z[WIP] Fix change on disk detectionThis will solve the whole change-on-disk-dection things similar as conflicts are solved for a shared-database. This PR builds on https://github.com/JabRef/jabref/pull/5640 and is an alternative to https://github.com/JabRef/jabref/pull/5665.
## Implementation motivation

column2: I designed the database synchronization feature (https://docs.jabref.org/collaborative-work/sqldatabase)
column3: which I briefly described at https://github.com/JabRef/jabref/pull/2866#issuecomment-388264343:

column1: - Multiple users should be supported ""seamlessly""
- If user A and B work on the bibfile
column2: a modification by user A on a bibtex entry B1 should not trigger any ""changes"" dialog if user B did not do any changes.

column1: - A ""Merge Entries"" dialog should popup if users A and B modified the same entry.
How this works can be tried out using the [Shared SQL Database Feature](http://help.jabref.org/en/SQLDatabase) of JabRef
column2: where @obraliar and me worked hard to  have a very nice user experience.

column1: Technically
column2: this is not that easy to achieve. However
column3: users will be happy
column4: if it ""just works"".

column1: At each instance of JabRef:
- Local state L is known
- Remote state R is known
- In case an update is made remotely
column2: the diff can be applied to R.

column1: So R' is known. Based on R and R'
column2: the entries E where a change was made
column3: are known.

column1: Based on E
column2: changes can be applied to L.

column1: If in L the entry was not modified: just apply the update.
If in L the entry was modified: Start the merge entries dialog.
## Implementation idea
![grafik](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1366654/69493789-68e51580-0eb3-11ea-9da8-319a9ebfb246.png)
## Current implementation state
TODO:
- Add tests (multi-threading: update file in parallel
- saved flag local in the update monitor
- Work on work on BibdatabaseDiff only
- Trigger the merge entries popup
Optional:
- Instead of the merge entries dialog
column2: the changes should be displayed

column1: - Add a button to the change display panel to open the merge entries dialog
column2: because the merge entries dialog has a visual diff instead of a text-only description.

column1: DONE:
- After a synchronization is triggered: the referenceFile is updated with the current database
- Synchronize change detection and file writing: should not happen in parallel
- Use !Thread.currentThread().isInterrupted() instead of true in endless loop in thread

The following version information is automatically determined by GitVersion based on the current tags.
|  Context      | Build version |  Build information |
| PR            | 5.0.X         | 5.0-branch.Y       |
Here
column2: `X` is the number of commits since the last tag; and `Y is the number of commits on this branch; and `branch` is the branch name. Build version is the version used in gradle
column3: i.e. the one used to generate the installer. Build information is what is displayed in the about dialog.

column1: (Not sure if it really works on the master as it should; couldn't test it so far).
It should also work with tags of the form `5.0-beta` (which have `build version = 5.0.X` and `build information = 5.0-beta`). Thus
column2: this PR hopefully also solves the problems of  https://github.com/JabRef/jabref/pull/5684.

column1: 5693dependabot-preview[bot]27856297closed2019-12-02T07:14:21Z2019-12-02T07:32:58ZBump richtextfx from 0.10.2 to 0.10.3"Bumps [richtextfx](https://github.com/FXMisc/RichTextFX) from 0.10.2 to 0.10.3.
<details>
<summary>Release notes</summary>
*Sourced from [richtextfx's releases](https://github.com/FXMisc/RichTextFX/releases).*
> This release features multi-release JAR files that are compatible with Java 8 and UP without the need for `add-exports` or `add-opens` JVM arguments.
> **Note** that you still need to include the JAR files on the classpath irrespective of the Java version being used.
> See the [Changelog](https://github.com/FXMisc/RichTextFX/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#v0103-2019-11-27)
> Notable enhancement is the addition of the following API:
> ```java
> append( SEG seg
column2: S style )

column1: > insert( int position
column2: SEG seg
column3: S style )

column1: > getParagraphGraphic( int parNdx )
> recreateParagraphGraphic( int parNdx )
> setParagraphInsertionStyle( PS paraStyle )
> setTextInsertionStyle( S txtStyle )
</details>
<details>
<summary>Changelog</summary>
*Sourced from [richtextfx's changelog](https://github.com/FXMisc/RichTextFX/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md).*
> ## [v0.10.3](https://github.com/FXMisc/RichTextFX/tree/v0.10.3) (2019-11-27)
> [Full Changelog](https://github.com/FXMisc/RichTextFX/compare/v0.10.2...v0.10.3)
> **Implemented enhancements:**
> - Added shift backspace to delete backward [\#855](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/FXMisc/RichTextFX/issues/855)
> - Added methods to recreate or get a paragraph graphic [\#854](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/FXMisc/RichTextFX/issues/854)
> - Added methods to preset the style of inserted text and paragraphs [\#864](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/FXMisc/RichTextFX/issues/864)
> - Added convenience API to EditActions and StyleClassedTextArea [\#868](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/FXMisc/RichTextFX/issues/868)
> - Added Bullet Lists to RichTextDemo [\#826](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/FXMisc/RichTextFX/issues/826)
> **Fixed bugs:**
> - Bug: Fixed line highlighter not adjusting to area's width changes [\#845](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/FXMisc/RichTextFX/pull/845#issuecomment-540535109)
> - Bug: Fixed not highlighting from beginning of line after adding text when empty [\#845](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/FXMisc/RichTextFX/pull/845#issuecomment-552252829)
> - Bug: Fixed line spacing not being applied between paragraphs [\#862](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/FXMisc/RichTextFX/issues/862)
> - Bug: Fixed anchor properties not updating correctly with listeners [\#874](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/FXMisc/RichTextFX/issues/874)
> **Other:**
> - Balanced linespacing above and below text for better highlighting look [\#872](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/FXMisc/RichTextFX/issues/872)
> - Changed styled-text-area CSS [\#738](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/FXMisc/RichTextFX/issues/738#issuecomment-555592054)
</details>

column1: 5696dependabot-preview[bot]27856297closed2019-12-02T07:16:02Z2019-12-02T07:22:37ZBump unirest-java from 3.1.04 to 3.2.00"Bumps [unirest-java](https://github.com/Kong/unirest-java) from 3.1.04 to 3.2.00.
<details>
<summary>Changelog</summary>
*Sourced from [unirest-java's changelog](https://github.com/Kong/unirest-java/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md).*
> * Allow users to inject a custom SSLContext into the Config for security
> * Allow for a custom interceptor that is called when
>    * Before the request
>    * After the request
>    * When a fatal connection error happens.
> * Directly exposing Apache Interceptors is now deprecated
> * [#319](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/Kong/unirest-java/issues/319) escape spaces and tabs in raw urls
> * Override  toString on Headers for better logging pr [#321](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/Kong/unirest-java/issues/321)
> * [#308](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/Kong/unirest-java/issues/308) When parsing an error body allow for non-parsing error bodies
> * [#301](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/Kong/unirest-java/issues/301) Unirest is now configured by default with a JsonObjectMapper
> * [#302](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/Kong/unirest-java/issues/302) Support a globally configured error consumer
> * JsonNode now has a ```toPrettyString``` method for getting a formatted json string

> * Replace the dependency on org.json with a native kong.unirest library powered by gson that matches org.json interfaces. See the [Upgrade Guide](https://github.com/Kong/unirest-java/blob/master/UPGRADE_GUIDE.md) for details.
> * Issue [#299](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/Kong/unirest-java/issues/299). Remove gzip content-encoding header after decompression on async client
> * [#308](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/Kong/unirest-java/issues/308) When parsing an error body allow for non-parsing error bodies
> * add an entire new return type: ```asBytes()``` (as well as async versions) will return a raw byte[] array.
> * Issue [#292](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/Kong/unirest-java/issues/292): Use per request Object Mapper for request bodies.
> * Catch the proper error rather than Exception in the old-apache compatibility fix
> * Update jackson-databind to 2.9.9.3 because .2 has shenanigans
> * Update jackson-databind to 2.9.9.2 to address moderate security vulnerability
> * Add ```FAIL_ON_UNKNOWN_PROPERTIES = false``` to the default Jackson object mapper.
> * Remember when an older version of apache was on the path for the remainder of the runtime
> * Skip calling apache method that may not exist if older versions of client are on the path to avoid MethodNotFound exceptions.
> * Add a config option for setting the TTL of persistent connections:/ issue [#286](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/Kong/unirest-java/issues/286)
> ... (truncated)
</details>
<details>
<summary>Commits</summary>
- [`0115aeb`](https://github.com/Kong/unirest-java/commit/0115aebf50bde90370b3cb50f95bd29ad020ca21) [maven-release-plugin] prepare release v3.2.00

- [`b1025ad`](https://github.com/Kong/unirest-java/commit/b1025ad5d71ef36037efae9e453b433e31ec8aca) some more documentation
- [`9b473ca`](https://github.com/Kong/unirest-java/commit/9b473ca589082967f1ef348f9397d9dcca2ff8ee) update changelog
- [`0a5a3c9`](https://github.com/Kong/unirest-java/commit/0a5a3c9d1f11158b82ca4a51388510f8e23f2755) add a test for the line seperator

- [`79fdc22`](https://github.com/Kong/unirest-java/commit/79fdc22c96d604d4d44736afcdcf5bce403b78e6) Merge pull request [#321](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/Kong/unirest-java/issues/321) from hilmarf/master
- [`13125d3`](https://github.com/Kong/unirest-java/commit/13125d3f68643eb2e0fb99b5553eecb8f4853520) +toString() for nicer logging/debugging

- [`3e2253e`](https://github.com/Kong/unirest-java/commit/3e2253eabce1a5042ef455af8c2d2429f70b72f9) also escape tabs for issue [#319](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/Kong/unirest-java/issues/319)

5721dependabot-preview[bot]27856297closed2019-12-09T07:18:06Z2019-12-09T07:38:14ZBump tika-core from 1.22 to 1.23"Bumps [tika-core](https://github.com/apache/tika) from 1.22 to 1.23.
<details>
<summary>Changelog</summary>
*Sourced from [tika-core's changelog](https://github.com/apache/tika/blob/master/CHANGES.txt).*
> Release 2.0.0 - ???
>    BREAKING CHANGES in 2.0.0
>    * Remove deprecated Metadata keys/properties (TIKA-1974).
>    Other changes
> Release 1.24 - ???
>    * Fix bug in ASM parser configuration (TIKA-2992).
>    * Upgrade to java-libpst 0.9.3 (TIKA-2546).
>    * NOTE: The PDFParser now relies on OCRDPI to render page images when
>      users configure OCR on rendered page images. This will have the effect
>      of increasing rendered image size (TIKA-2624).
>    * NOTE: tika-server no longer returns 415 for file types for which there
>      is no parser.
>    * Fix bug in AUTO OCR strategy in the PDFParser (TIKA-3002).
>    * Fix incorrect height and width metadata extraction from JPEG images (TIKA-2630).
>    * Upgrade to POI 4.1.1 (TIKA-2851).
>    * Upgrade to PDFBox 2.0.17 (TIKA-2951).
>    * Ensure that the PDFParser respects custom configuration of Tesseract
>      from tika-config.xml via Eric Pugh (TIKA-2970).
>    * Add parser for XLIFF v1.2 files (TIKA-2975).
>    * Add mime type detection support for WebAssembly (TIKA-2894)
>      HEIF / HEIC images (TIKA-2942)
column2: Digilite FDF (TIKA-2988);

column1: >      and xml-root detection for XFDF (TIKA-2990) and XDP (TIKA-2989).
>    * Add an XLZ Parser (TIKA-2976).

>    * NOTE: tika-server no longer hard-codes the HtmlParser to handle
>      XML files (TIKA-2910).  Users must now configure that behavior
>      via a tika-config.xml file.
>    * NOTE: Known regression: PDFBOX-4587 -- PDF passwords with codepoints

column1: 5722dependabot-preview[bot]27856297closed2019-12-09T07:18:33Z2019-12-09T07:32:27ZBump postgresql from 42.2.8 to 42.2.9"Bumps [postgresql](https://github.com/pgjdbc/pgjdbc) from 42.2.8 to 42.2.9.
<details>
<summary>Changelog</summary>
*Sourced from [postgresql's changelog](https://github.com/pgjdbc/pgjdbc/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md).*
> ### Changed
> ### Added
>  - read only transactions [PR 1252](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/pgjdbc/pgjdbc/pull/1252)
>  - pkcs12 key functionality [PR 1599](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/pgjdbc/pgjdbc/pull/1599)
>  - new ""escapeSyntaxCallMode"" connection property [PR 1560](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/pgjdbc/pgjdbc/pull/1560)
>  - connection property to limit server error detail in exception exceptions [PR 1579](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/pgjdbc/pgjdbc/pull/1579)
>  - cancelQuery() to PGConnection public interface [PR 1157](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/pgjdbc/pgjdbc/pull/1157)
>  - support for large update counts (JDBC 4.2) [PR 935](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/pgjdbc/pgjdbc/pull/935)
>  - Add Binary Support for Oid.NUMERIC and Oid.NUMERIC_ARRAY [PR 1636](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/pgjdbc/pgjdbc/pull/1636)
> ### Fixed
>  - issue 716 getTypeInfo() may not return data in the order specified in Oracle documentation [PR 1506](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/pgjdbc/pgjdbc/pull/1506)
>  - PgSQLXML setCharacterStream() results in null value  [PR 1608](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/pgjdbc/pgjdbc/pull/1608)
>  - get correct column length for simple domains [PR 1605](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/pgjdbc/pgjdbc/pull/1605)

>  - NPE as a result of calling executeQuery twice on a statement fixes issue [#684](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/pgjdbc/pgjdbc/issues/684) [PR 1610] (https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/pgjdbc/pgjdbc/pull/1610)
>  - handle numeric domain types [PR 1611](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/pgjdbc/pgjdbc/pull/1611)
>  - pginterval to take iso8601 strings [PR 1612](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/pgjdbc/pgjdbc/pull/1612)
>  - remove currentTimeMillis from code
column2: tests are OK [PR 1617](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/pgjdbc/pgjdbc/pull/1617)

column1: >  - NPE when calling setNull on a PreparedStatement with no parameters [PR 1620](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/pgjdbc/pgjdbc/pull/1620)
>  - allow OUT parameter registration when using CallableStatement native CALL [PR 1561](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/pgjdbc/pgjdbc/pull/1561)
>  - add release save point into execute with batch [PR 1583](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/pgjdbc/pgjdbc/pull/1583)
>  - Prevent use of extended query protocol for BEGIN before COPY [PR 1639](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/pgjdbc/pgjdbc/pull/1639)
</details>
